 Who we are:  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 
  Reporting to Facilities Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Responsible for completing assigned repairs, maintenance and minor construction tasks and carrying out planned maintenance program for the entire association 
   Responsible for ensuring the properties operate in a clean and safe manner 
   To operate all equipment /tools in a safe manner 
   Other duties as assigned 
  
 
 Why it matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $675 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in facilities management and 
   
  
   You have experience and/or knowledge in plumbing, electrical, painting and overall general maintenance skills 
   You have a strong knowledge and background in carpentry 
   You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
   You are honest, trustworthy, are results orientated, and are proud of the work that you do 
   You have the ability to work in a fast -paced environment 
   Must have a valid Class 5 license – travel is required through out the Lake Country Co-op trading area 
   Must be physically fit – physical labour is required 
  
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted. 
  ADMIN Job Posting # 2024-004
descriptionHTML:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full Time Facilities Person to join our Team in Prince Albert, Sk.

Who we are:
Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs

Reporting to Facilities Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following:
  • Responsible for completing assigned repairs, maintenance and minor construction tasks and carrying out planned maintenance program for the entire association
  • Responsible for ensuring the properties operate in a clean and safe manner
  • To operate all equipment /tools in a safe manner
  • Other duties as assigned

Why it matters:
Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $675 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together.

Who you are:
You are looking for a career in facilities management and
  • You have experience and/or knowledge in plumbing, electrical, painting and overall general maintenance skills
  • You have a strong knowledge and background in carpentry
  • You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision
  • You are honest, trustworthy, are results orientated, and are proud of the work that you do
  • You have the ability to work in a fast -paced environment
  • Must have a valid Class 5 license – travel is required through out the Lake Country Co-op trading area
  • Must be physically fit – physical labour is required

Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation.

At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.


ADMIN Job Posting # 2024-004
positionName: Facilities Clerk - Lake Country Co-op @ Prince Albert

companyInfo/companyDescription:
The Nature Conservancy of Canada (NCC) directly protects and cares for our country's most vulnerable natural areas & the plants & animals they sustain.



Organization Overview



NCC is Canada's leading national land conservation organization. We are a private, non-profit group that partners with corporations, individuals, communities and government bodies to achieve the direct protection of our most important natural treasures. Since 1962, NCC and our partners have helped to conserve 14 million hectares (35 million acres) of ecologically significant land nationwide.
description:
Veiller sur l’environnement n’a jamais été aussi important qu’aujourd’hui. Conservation de la nature Canada (CNC) est à la recherche d’une ou d’un stagiaire en gestion de données pour se joindre à notre équipe qui œuvre à la protection de nos milieux naturels les plus précieux et des espèces animales et végétales qu’ils abritent.
   Chef de file en conservation de terres privées au Canada et organisme sans but lucratif, Conservation de la nature Canada (CNC) œuvre à la protection de nos milieux naturels les plus précieux et des espèces qu’ils abritent. Depuis 1962, CNC et ses partenaires ont contribué à la protection de 15 millions d’hectares de terres de grande valeur écologique à travers le Canada. Grâce à son approche axée sur la science et sur la collaboration, CNC obtient des réussites en matière de conservation, au bénéfice de la nature et de la population. Comptant un bureau national situé à Toronto et des bureaux régionaux à travers le pays, CNC arrive à obtenir des résultats concrets.
  
   Objectif et description générale :
   La conservation de certains des milieux naturels les plus importants de la Saskatchewan vous passionne-t-elle? Voulez-vous avoir un impact positif et durable sur la nature? Cherchez-vous un poste bien équilibré pour lancer votre carrière dans le domaine de la conservation en acquérant une expérience pratique en gestion de données? Nous voulons vous rencontrer!
   CNC est à la recherche d’une personne passionnée pour se joindre à l’équipe des sciences de la Saskatchewan en tant que stagiaire en gestion de données. En étroite collaboration avec le responsable, science et planification en conservation, la personne retenue pour ce poste apportera son soutien à l’équipe des sciences dans la prestation de tous les services d’appui à la gestion des bases de données régionales, et ce, tout au long de la saison de travail sur le terrain de 2024. Cela comprend notamment la gestion de la base de données interne Land Resource Manager de CNC, ainsi qu’assurer une gestion des données spatiales et fournir un soutien grâce à des systèmes d’information géographique (SIG). Le ou la stagiaire en gestion de données peut être appelé(e) à travailler directement avec d’autres membres de l’équipe de conservation et d’intendance. Il sera également possible de travailler en étroite collaboration avec des organisations partenaires, des intendants locaux et des bénévoles. Ce poste vise à offrir à un(e) jeune professionnel(le) un environnement stimulant et axé sur l’apprentissage. Ce poste se caractérise principalement par des tâches techniques et opérationnelles, mais il peut aussi inclure du travail de terrain lié à des activités d’intendance ou de mobilisation.
  
   Tâches et responsabilités :
   Soutenir l’équipe de conservation de la Saskatchewan par le biais de diverses tâches, y compris :
  
    Mettre à jour le Land Resource Manager (LRM) de CNC en y intégrant des informations sur les projets de conservation actuels et récents.
    Effectuer un contrôle de qualité des données.
    Compiler les données des partenaires et préparer les soumissions de données destinées aux organisations partenaires.
    Effectuer des requêtes de données à des fins d’établissement de rapports.
    Assurer la gestion des données spatiales actuelles et récentes.
    Contribuer à la production de divers produits cartographiques et ensembles de données spatiales, selon les besoins.
    Apporter son soutien aux équipes régionales de conservation, de développement, de communication et de gestion quant à la gestion des données et aux demandes de données, le cas échéant.
    Fournir au personnel de terrain responsable de l’intendance pendant la période estivale du soutien en matière de GRL, de SIG et de GPS, selon les besoins.
    Apporter son soutien au travail sur le terrain lié à l’intendance ou à la mobilisation, selon les besoins.
  
  
   Compétences et caractéristiques requises :
   Ce poste s’adresse aux personnes qui possèdent les compétences suivantes :
  
    Expérience en gestion de données.
    Solides connaissances pratiques d’autres applications informatiques courantes (p. ex. Word, Access, Excel).
    Expérience avec le logiciel ArcGIS desktop, considérée comme un atout majeur. Cela inclut :
    
      Gestion, maintenance et approvisionnement d’ensembles de données spatiales.
      Production de cartes et/ou d’autres supports graphiques et de rapports.
      Analyse et édition de données à l’aide d’outils d’édition spatiale.
    
    Expérience avec ArcGIS Online, considérée comme un atout.
    Expérience des outils SIG, y compris Field Maps et Survey 123, considérée comme un atout.
    Maîtrise de Model Builder et/ou de l’écriture de scripts, considérée comme un atout.
    Capacité éprouvée à respecter les délais et à répondre aux attentes de manière indépendante, tout en fournissant des résultats de qualité.
    Capacité à communiquer clairement par écrit, oralement et graphiquement.
    Expérience professionnelle ou formation dans le domaine de la biologie, de l’écologie ou de la conservation considérée comme un atout.
    Capacité à gérer des documents hautement confidentiels.
    Engagement à l’égard de l’objectif et des valeurs de CNC.
    Volonté manifeste de se perfectionner.
  
   Admissibilité :
   Le financement de ce poste exige que les stagiaires répondent aux critères suivants :
  
    Avoir entre 15 et 30 ans (inclusivement) au début de l’emploi.
    Être de citoyenneté canadienne, être résident(e) permanent(e) ou être une personne à qui l’asile a été conféré en vertu de la Loi sur l’immigration et la protection des réfugiés pour la durée de l’emploi.
    La personne retenue doit avoir un numéro d’assurance sociale valide au moment de son entrée en fonction et être légalement autorisée à travailler au Canada, conformément aux lois et aux réglementations provinciales ou territoriales en vigueur.
  
  
   Conditions d’emploi :
  
    Sous réserve de financement, il s'agit d’un poste de 16 semaines, du 13 mai 2024 au 31 août 2024 (avec possibilité de prolongement).
    Rémunération : 18,00 $/heure.
    Le poste sera basé au bureau de Saskatoon ou de Regina, en Saskatchewan. Il est possible que des déplacements soient requis à l’intérieur de la province.
    Il peut être nécessaire de travailler le soir et la fin de semaine, mais cela est peu fréquent.
  
  
   Pour poser votre candidature :
   CNC est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre équipe, veuillez soumettre votre candidature par l’entremise de la page du Programme de stages en conservation de notre Centre des carrières.
  
   Date limite :
   22 mars 2024, 23 h 59 HNE, 21 h 59 HNR, 20 h 59 HAP, 22 h 50 HNC, 00 h 59 + +1 HNA.
  
   CNC recrute sur la base du mérite et s'engage fermement en faveur de l'équité et de la diversité sur le lieu de travail. Nous nous efforçons de réaliser des projets de conservation audacieux dans lesquels l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion (EDI) sont la norme. Nous acceptons les candidatures des personnes racialisées/des minorités visibles, des femmes, des autochtones, des personnes handicapées, des minorités ethniques et des personnes ayant une orientation sexuelle ou une identité de genre minoritaire, ainsi que celles de tous les candidats qualifiés possédant les compétences et les connaissances nécessaires pour s'engager de manière productive auprès de diverses communautés. CNC met en œuvre un programme d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les membres des groupes désignés à s'auto-identifier.
   Des adaptations sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidat(e)s participant à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour une demande confidentielle, envoyez-nous un courriel au rh@conservationdelanature.ca pour prendre des dispositions. Si vous avez des questions concernant les emplois accessibles chez CNC, veuillez envoyer un courriel à notre équipe au rh@conservationdelanature.ca.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Cameco is one of the world’s largest providers of the uranium needed to generate clean, reliable baseload electricity around the globe. Our tier-one operations in Canada and Kazakhstan have the licensed capacity to produce more than 53 million pounds (100% basis) each year. We hold about 467 million pounds of proven and probable reserves and extensive resources on three continents. Our exploration program spans about 1.7 million acres of land, most of it near our existing operations. We are also a leading provider of nuclear fuel processing services, supplying much of the world's reactor fleet with the fuel to generate one of the cleanest sources of electricity available today.

​If you’re looking to work in a unique, high-profile industry with worldwide operations and diverse scientific, political and environmental components - then you’re looking for Cameco. We employ a wide range of occupations including - but not limited to - engineers, geologists, technologist, scientists and operators, plus an assortment of trades, from electricians to industrial mechanics.
description:
Job Category: Supply Chain 
  Location: Saskatoon 
  Work Contract: Temp Full-Time H (K5)
   
   
  At Cameco we understand the value of a diverse workforce and we embrace, encourage and support workplace inclusion and diversity. New ideas, perspectives, experiences, and expertise make Cameco stronger. We are committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the communities we operate in. Our vision is to create a culture where inclusion is the goal, and a diverse and representative workforce is our measure of success. Cameco is committed to providing an inclusive selection process, free from systemic barriers. support employment equity and encourage all members of underrepresented groups (i.e., women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities and members of racialized groups/visible minorities) to voluntarily disclose. Cameco welcomes applicants from all backgrounds, abilities, and experiences to apply.
   
   
  About Us
   
   
  Cameco is one of the largest global providers of the uranium fuel needed to energize a clean-air world. Utilities around the world rely on our nuclear fuel products to generate safe, reliable, emissions-free nuclear power. Cameco’s corporate office is based in Saskatoon. We have mining operations and projects in northern Saskatchewan, Kazakhstan, the United States and Australia. We are also a leading supplier of uranium refining, conversion, and fuel manufacturing services from our operations in Ontario.
   
   
  The Role
   
   
  In this role, you will:
   
   
  
   Assist in the daily activities at the transit warehouse in Saskatoon, including receiving freight, entering data into SAP, dealing with couriers, filing packing slips and other administrative work as assigned 
   The successful candidates will work a term of approximately four months (May to August) and will assist with a variety of special projects and other day-to-day activities 
   Work an eight-hour shift between the hours of 8:00 am and 4:30 pm on a Monday - Friday basis
  
   
   
  
  Required:
   
   
  
   You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education. You must be returning to school for the academic semester following your work term with Cameco
  
   
   
  
  Conditions of Employment:
   
  
  
   Pre-employment Substance Test
  
   
  Cameco is an employment equity employer and aims to achieve gender parity, and as such, preference will be given to qualified members of equity groups. We are strengthened by the diverse backgrounds of experiences and encourage applicants with various levels of expertise to apply, as equivalent combination of education and work experience are considered.
   
   
  This is a 4-month full-time temporary student term, starting May 2024 until end of August 2024. 
  Req ID #: 39252 
  Posted: February 20, 2024 
  Posting end date: March 5, 2024 Salary Range: $44,710 - $51,590
   
   
  Safety Sensitive Position 
  The physical and psychological safety of our employee’s is a top priority at Cameco. We invite candidates to voluntarily disclose accommodation requirements, if contacted in relation to a job opportunity. Information received will be addressed confidentially and Cameco’s Workplace Inclusion and Accommodation Program document is available upon request. Successful candidates for all positions that will work at Safety Sensitive Sites or Safety Sensitive Positions must take and pass a Substance Test, which includes marijuana, as a condition of employment. Marijuana remains in a user’s system for about 30 days, so applicants who recently used marijuana recreationally should not expect to pass a substance test.

Location: Saskatoon

Work Contract: Temp Full-Time H (K5)


At Cameco we understand the value of a diverse workforce and we embrace, encourage and support workplace inclusion and diversity. About Us


Cameco is one of the largest global providers of the uranium fuel needed to energize a clean-air world. Utilities around the world rely on our nuclear fuel products to generate safe, reliable, emissions-free nuclear power. Cameco’s corporate office is based in Saskatoon. We have mining operations and projects in northern Saskatchewan, Kazakhstan, the United States and Australia. We are also a leading supplier of uranium refining, conversion, and fuel manufacturing services from our operations in Ontario.


The Role


In this role, you will:


  • Assist in the daily activities at the transit warehouse in Saskatoon, including receiving freight, entering data into SAP, dealing with couriers, filing packing slips and other administrative work as assigned
  • The successful candidates will work a term of approximately four months (May to August) and will assist with a variety of special projects and other day-to-day activities
  • Work an eight-hour shift between the hours of 8:00 am and 4:30 pm on a Monday - Friday basis

Required:


  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education. You must be returning to school for the academic semester following your work term with Cameco

Conditions of Employment:


  • Pre-employment Substance Test


Cameco is an employment equity employer and aims to achieve gender parity, and as such, preference will be given to qualified members of equity groups. We are strengthened by the diverse backgrounds of experiences and encourage applicants with various levels of expertise to apply, as equivalent combination of education and work experience are considered.


This is a 4-month full-time temporary student term, starting May 2024 until end of August 2024.

Req ID #: 39252

Posted: February 20, 2024

Posting end date: March 5, 2024
Salary Range: $44,710 - $51,590


Safety Sensitive Position

The physical and psychological safety of our employee’s is a top priority at Cameco. We invite candidates to voluntarily disclose accommodation requirements, if contacted in relation to a job opportunity. Information received will be addressed confidentially and Cameco’s Workplace Inclusion and Accommodation Program document is available upon request. Successful candidates for all positions that will work at Safety Sensitive Sites or Safety Sensitive Positions must take and pass a Substance Test, which includes marijuana, as a condition of employment. Marijuana remains in a user’s system for about 30 days, so applicants who recently used marijuana recreationally should not expect to pass a substance test.

We are also a leading provider of nuclear fuel processing services, supplying much of the world's reactor fleet with the fuel to generate one of the cleanest sources of electricity available today.

​If you’re looking to work in a unique, high-profile industry with worldwide operations and diverse scientific, political and environmental components - then you’re looking for Cameco. We employ a wide range of occupations including - but not limited to - engineers, geologists, technologist, scientists and operators, plus an assortment of trades, from electricians to industrial mechanics.
description:
Job Category: Supply Chain 
  Location: Saskatoon 
  Work Contract: Temp Full-Time H (K5)
   
   
  At Cameco we understand the value of a diverse workforce and we embrace, encourage and support workplace inclusion and diversity. New ideas, perspectives, experiences, and expertise make Cameco stronger. We are committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the communities we operate in. Our vision is to create a culture where inclusion is the goal, and a diverse and representative workforce is our measure of success. Cameco is committed to providing an inclusive selection process, free from systemic barriers. support employment equity and encourage all members of underrepresented groups (i.e., women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities and members of racialized groups/visible minorities) to voluntarily disclose. Cameco welcomes applicants from all backgrounds, abilities, and experiences to apply.
   
   
  About Us
   
   
  Cameco is one of the largest global providers of the uranium fuel needed to energize a clean-air world. Utilities around the world rely on our nuclear fuel products to generate safe, reliable, emissions-free nuclear power. Cameco’s corporate office is based in Saskatoon. We have mining operations and projects in northern Saskatchewan, Kazakhstan, the United States and Australia. We are also a leading supplier of uranium refining, conversion, and fuel manufacturing services from our operations in Ontario.
   
   
  The Role
   
   
  In this role, you will:
   
   
  
   Assist in the daily activities at the transit warehouse in Saskatoon, including receiving freight, entering data into SAP, dealing with couriers, filing packing slips and other administrative work as assigned 
   The successful candidates will work a term of approximately four months (May to August) and will assist with a variety of special projects and other day-to-day activities 
   Work an eight-hour shift between the hours of 8:00 am and 4:30 pm on a Monday - Friday basis
  
   
   
  
  Required:
   
   
  
   You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education. You must be returning to school for the academic semester following your work term with Cameco
  
   
   
  
  Conditions of Employment:
   
  
  
   Pre-employment Substance Test
  
   
  Cameco is an employment equity employer and aims to achieve gender parity, and as such, preference will be given to qualified members of equity groups. We are strengthened by the diverse backgrounds of experiences and encourage applicants with various levels of expertise to apply, as equivalent combination of education and work experience are considered.
   
   
  This is a 4-month full-time temporary student term, starting May 2024 until end of August 2024. 
  Req ID #: 39252 
  Posted: February 20, 2024 
  Posting end date: March 5, 2024 Salary Range: $44,710 - $51,590
   
   
  Safety Sensitive Position 
  The physical and psychological safety of our employee’s is a top priority at Cameco. We invite candidates to voluntarily disclose accommodation requirements, if contacted in relation to a job opportunity. Information received will be addressed confidentially and Cameco’s Workplace Inclusion and Accommodation Program document is available upon request. Successful candidates for all positions that will work at Safety Sensitive Sites or Safety Sensitive Positions must take and pass a Substance Test, which includes marijuana, as a condition of employment. Marijuana remains in a user’s system for about 30 days, so applicants who recently used marijuana recreationally should not expect to pass a substance test.

About Us


Cameco is one of the largest global providers of the uranium fuel needed to energize a clean-air world. We are also a leading supplier of uranium refining, conversion, and fuel manufacturing services from our operations in Ontario.


The Role


In this role, you will:


  • Assist in the daily activities at the transit warehouse in Saskatoon, including receiving freight, entering data into SAP, dealing with couriers, filing packing slips and other administrative work as assigned
  • The successful candidates will work a term of approximately four months (May to August) and will assist with a variety of special projects and other day-to-day activities
  • Work an eight-hour shift between the hours of 8:00 am and 4:30 pm on a Monday - Friday basis

Required:


  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education. You must be returning to school for the academic semester following your work term with Cameco

Conditions of Employment:


  • Pre-employment Substance Test


Cameco is an employment equity employer and aims to achieve gender parity, and as such, preference will be given to qualified members of equity groups. We are strengthened by the diverse backgrounds of experiences and encourage applicants with various levels of expertise to apply, as equivalent combination of education and work experience are considered.


This is a 4-month full-time temporary student term, starting May 2024 until end of August 2024.

Req ID #: 39252

Posted: February 20, 2024

Posting end date: March 5, 2024
Salary Range: $44,710 - $51,590


Safety Sensitive Position

The physical and psychological safety of our employee’s is a top priority at Cameco. We invite candidates to voluntarily disclose accommodation requirements, if contacted in relation to a job opportunity. Information received will be addressed confidentially and Cameco’s Workplace Inclusion and Accommodation Program document is available upon request. Successful candidates for all positions that will work at Safety Sensitive Sites or Safety Sensitive Positions must take and pass a Substance Test, which includes marijuana, as a condition of employment. Marijuana remains in a user’s system for about 30 days, so applicants who recently used marijuana recreationally should not expect to pass a substance test.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Our customers are at the heart of our organization. We invest to earn your business; we invest more to keep it. Spartan Controls Ltd. is the leading provider of industrial automation solutions in Western Canada. Spartan works to provide customers with high performance solutions, industry experience, lifecycle support, and technical training - delivering value our customers want.

As an Emerson Impact Partner, we are a local, single point of contact for sales, service and applied engineering for Emerson’s automation solutions business. 

We combine our local capabilities with Emerson’s global reach and scale enabling Customers to achieve Top Quartile performance by providing control, reliability, safety and optimization solutions.

Our story is based on a broad employee ownership model, the belief then and now is ‘owners’ will drive and provide the highest level of commitment, entrepreneurship and customer service. 

The name 'Spartan' was selected as a reflection of the Spartans of ancient Greece, who were noted for their efficiency, competitiveness, and organization abilities. Today, we are organized across three provinces where local teams work to understand Customer challenges and deliver value the Customer wants.
description:
Spartan Controls provides an exciting culture of community, creativity, entrepreneurship, and a place to build your career. We support our students’ education and growth through networking, job shadowing, student events, opportunities to work with our Senior Leaders, and more!
 
  Spartan Controls is an employee-owned company and leading provider of data management, industrial automation, valves, measurement and control solutions for process industries in Western Canada and beyond. We are dedicated to providing exceptional sales, support and service experiences for our diverse customer base in industries such as mining, power, oil & gas, municipal, pulp & paper, and chemical.
  
 
  
   
    Summary
   
   
     We are recruiting for an Application Specialist (Sales) Engineering Co-op Student for a 12-month work term (starting May 2024) to work with our Valves & Actuation, Measurement Instrumentation, and Controls Systems, Inside Sales teams in Regina, SK. Reporting to the Manager, Application Specialists, this is an excellent opportunity to hone your customer service skills and expand your knowledge of the process control industry.
     Working alongside Application Specialists in this technical sales role, you will gain insight into a variety of industries (e.g. power, mining, oil & gas) and their unique process control requirements. Our Application Specialist team consists of individuals who specialize in providing customers with application, instrumentation, and process solutions by way of sizing & selecting controls valves, specifying measurement devices (e.g., pressure, temperature, flow, pH, etc.) and making recommendations for manual and automated on/off valves.
   
  
  
   
     Role and Responsibilities
   
   
    
      Assist Application Specialist team in generating quotations and proposals for our customers day to day operations as well as expansion project pursuits.
      Respond to incoming customer inquiries for technical information and quotations
      Evaluate process requirements and budgets to develop technical solutions
      Use Spartan’s business systems to size and select equipment and generate quotations and proposals 
    
   
  
  
   
     Qualifications and Skills
   
   
    
      Enrollment in Post-Secondary education program in Mechanical, Electrical, or Process Engineering
      Proficient with MS Office programs; Word, Power Point, Excel
      Strong technical problem-solving skills
      Demonstrated customer service and sales skills in an industrial environment an asset
      Ability to develop and foster relationships with coworkers and customers
      Customer-centric mindset and collaborative team player
      Excellent communication, planning, scheduling, prioritization, and time management skills
      High degree of dependability and reliability
      Detail oriented
      Entrepreneurial work ethic
    
   
  
 
  Spartan recognizes that there are many ways in which candidates develop knowledge, abilities, and competencies throughout their careers. We encourage applications from candidates with a variety of backgrounds and we do consider qualifications and competencies that are equivalent to those specifically mentioned above.
 
  Close Date: March 10, 2024 (11:59 pm MST)
  IND123
  Requisition ID: [[1031]]

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Cameco is one of the world’s largest providers of the uranium needed to generate clean, reliable baseload electricity around the globe. Our tier-one operations in Canada and Kazakhstan have the licensed capacity to produce more than 53 million pounds (100% basis) each year. We hold about 467 million pounds of proven and probable reserves and extensive resources on three continents. Our exploration program spans about 1.7 million acres of land, most of it near our existing operations. We are also a leading provider of nuclear fuel processing services, supplying much of the world's reactor fleet with the fuel to generate one of the cleanest sources of electricity available today.

​If you’re looking to work in a unique, high-profile industry with worldwide operations and diverse scientific, political and environmental components - then you’re looking for Cameco. We employ a wide range of occupations including - but not limited to - engineers, geologists, technologist, scientists and operators, plus an assortment of trades, from electricians to industrial mechanics.

description:
Join the Code Ninjas team in Regina this summer for an unforgettable experience! We're looking for a dynamic and energetic Summer Camp Leader to guide and inspire the next generation of coders. If you're passionate about technology and love working with kids, this is the perfect opportunity for you!
As a Summer Camp Leader, you will be responsible for leading a group of students through hands-on coding projects and activities. You'll help kids develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration skills while they have fun learning to code. Your energy and enthusiasm will be key to creating an exciting and engaging atmosphere for the students.
Requirements:

 Currently enrolled in a Post Secondary program in a relative field and expected to return in the fall (ie: teaching, computer science, software engineering, early childhood education, etc)
 Experience working with kids and/or teaching
 Passion for technology and coding
 Ability to communicate effectively with children and adults
 Excellent organizational and leadership skills
 Knowledge in the areas of coding, science and technology
 Understanding of computer systems and video games

This is a full-time, term position for the summer months, with opportunities for advancement within the organization in the fall. If you're ready for a summer filled with fun, learning, and making a difference, apply now!
At Code Ninjas, we believe that every child should have the opportunity to learn to code and we're committed to making that happen. We offer a supportive and inclusive work environment where you can grow both personally and professionally. Let's code the future together!
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-opContract length: 12 weeks
Salary: $16.00-$17.00 per hour
Expected hours: 37.5 per week
Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

 Have you worked with children before? Explain your experience.
 Are you available weekdays (8:30am-4:30pm) from June 10 - Sept 2
 Are you eligible to work under the Canada Summer Jobs program as a permanent resident, citizen or refugee, and a current student returning to studies in the fall? Details can be found at canada. ca under CSJ eligibility.

Education:

 Secondary School (preferred)

Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024-04-30Expected start date: 2024-06-10

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
Pay Band: UNDEFINED
 
  At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  As an Intern, IT, you will join the Potash IT team and become part of a larger Nutrien IT team and will share responsibility for supporting all the IT systems. You could be asked to do everything from providing support to users to implementing advanced networks to collaborating on the use of innovative technologies to solve business problems. As an Intern, IT, you will be responsible for maintaining and supporting our implemented information and communication systems and technology. This position will collaborate with local and Corporate IT teams to maintain systems and satisfy end user requests. This is a great opportunity to get exposed to all aspects of systems administration including Cisco networking, VMWare & Microsoft administration.
 
  This position reports to the Director, IT, Potash. This is a student job with flexible start date and term length for 2024.
 
  What you will do:
 
   Providing IT technical support to Nutrien users
   Hardware & software deployment, management, and support
   Exposure Cisco networking, VMWare & Microsoft systems administration
   Supporting innovative IT projects in mining
 
 
  What you will bring:
 
   Must be currently enrolled in, and returning to a Computer Science, Technology, MIS, Data Science, Business Analysis or equivalent degree/diploma program from an accredited post-secondary institution
   Demonstrated positive safety behaviour and safety leadership
   Willingness to learn and gain knowledge and experience through training
   Excellent interpersonal teamwork and communication skills
   Motivation to set and achieve goals
   Self-starter with the ability to take initiative and nurture projects forward
   Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities
   Alignment with Nutrien’s purpose and values
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
descriptionHTML:
Pay Band: UNDEFINED


At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.


Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.


We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.


Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.


As an Intern, IT, you will join the Potash IT team and become part of a larger Nutrien IT team and will share responsibility for supporting all the IT systems. You could be asked to do everything from providing support to users to implementing advanced networks to collaborating on the use of innovative technologies to solve business problems. As an Intern, IT, you will be responsible for maintaining and supporting our implemented information and communication systems and technology. This position will collaborate with local and Corporate IT teams to maintain systems and satisfy end user requests. This is a great opportunity to get exposed to all aspects of systems administration including Cisco networking, VMWare & Microsoft administration.


This position reports to the Director, IT, Potash. This is a student job with flexible start date and term length for 2024.


What you will do:

  • Providing IT technical support to Nutrien users
  • Hardware & software deployment, management, and support
  • Exposure Cisco networking, VMWare & Microsoft systems administration
  • Supporting innovative IT projects in mining


What you will bring:

  • Must be currently enrolled in, and returning to a Computer Science, Technology, MIS, Data Science, Business Analysis or equivalent degree/diploma program from an accredited post-secondary institution
  • Demonstrated positive safety behaviour and safety leadership
  • Willingness to learn and gain knowledge and experience through training
  • Excellent interpersonal teamwork and communication skills
  • Motivation to set and achieve goals
  • Self-starter with the ability to take initiative and nurture projects forward
  • Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities
  • Alignment with Nutrien’s purpose and values

Are you a good match? Apply today!


Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.


This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

description:
To come to work with a positive, professional approach and attitude, as well as to be dependable for all scheduled shifts. 
  To provide outstanding courteous customer service. 
  To provide a neat, clean and well merchandised front-end at all times. 
  To have a good working understanding of the till operation. 
  To engage in and supervise the packing of customer purchases at the checkout counter. 
  To be familiar with and adhere to Delta Co-op policies and procedures. 
  To assist in general stock duties, including filling shelves when not cashing. 
  To achieve accurate cash balances.

description:
The Mosaic Company (NYSE: MOS) is the world’s leading integrated producer of concentrated phosphate and potash—two of the three most important nutrients in agriculture. We employ more than 13,000 people in six countries to serve farmers all over the world. Our Headquarters is in Lithia, Florida with operations throughout North America (U.S./Canada) and South America.
 
 
 
   At Mosaic We Help the World Grow the Food it Needs - Apply today and join our team!
 
 
 
  
    Process Engineer Co-Op/Intern
  
 
 
  
    A Process Engineer Co-Op/Intern at Mosaic will be assigned to special projects and will assist other engineers on major projects and day-to-day troubleshooting to optimize mill performance. Projects will focus on improving facility efficiency and final product quality.
  
 
 
 
  
    Where will you work?
  
  
    Mosaic Potash Esterhazy is an underground potash mine located 90 kilometers south of Yorkton. It’s split between three mine sites - K1, K2 and K3 which will be the largest, and one of the world’s most competitive underground potash mines in the world.
  
  
    Housing and relocation can be provided for qualified candidates.
  
  
  
   
    
      Term
    
   
   
    
      September 9 – December 20, 2024
    
    
      Full time Co-Op/Internship. 36-40 hrs a week on site.
    
   
   
   
     What will you do?
   
  
  
  
   
     Work at the K1 or K2 surface milling facility.
   
   
     Day-to-day work assignments could include fieldwork, e.g. data analysis, report writing, and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs).
   
   
     Projects will be assigned by the supervisor and could include:
   
   
     o Troubleshooting to identify root cause of problems
   
   
     o Projects to optimize process controls
   
   
     o Mass and energy balances for various types of chemical processes
   
   
     o Communication/operator training for project implementation
   
   
     o Assist Turnaround and Repair Day equipment inspections as required
   
   
     Communicate with various levels of personnel throughout the organization, including management, plant operators, engineers (of various disciplines), lab personnel, and contractors
     Participation in department meetings and meetings specific to the project assignment
     Adhering to Mosaic’s mission, guiding principles and priorities, and key competencies
   
  
  
  
    What do you need for this role?
  
  
  
   
    
     
      
        Second year or higher pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemical, Industrial, Mechanical and or Process Engineering
      
     
      
        General understanding of engineering concepts and a desire to learn
      
     
      
        Ability to function in an industrial chemical and mining environment
      
     
      
        1-2 years of experience volunteering, working with student/school organizations, or work is preferred
      
     
      
        Previous internship or co-op experience is preferred
      
     
      
        Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license - You will need to be able to travel to and from sites and/or office.
      
     
      
        Basic computer skills are required
      
     
      
        Experience working in a team environment is a must
      
     
      
        Familiarity with an industrial environment is highly desirable
      
     
      
        Effective verbal communication skills is a plus
      
     
      
        Physical work environment is occasionally outdoors with exposure to varying degrees of hot and cold environments
      
    
   
  
  
  
   
    
      The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
    
    
     
      
        Must be able to safely perform the essential functions of the job without posing a direct threat to the safety of his or her own self, or the safety of others.
      
     
      
        Able to lift approximately 0-25 lbs. occasionally.
      
     
      
        Able to climb stairs and work at various heights.
      
     
      
        Able to distinguish varying or specific colors, patterns or materials.
      
     
      
        Able to hear, with or without correction.
      
     
      
        Able to read, write and understand basic English.
      
     
      
        Able to see, with or without correction.
      
     
      
        Able to use fine hand motor skills.
      
     
      
        Able to wear a respirator.
      
     
      
        Able to work rotating shifts and overtime as required.
      
     
      
        Must be able to work a 12-hour shift.
      
     
      
        Must be authorized to work in Canada.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
The Nature Conservancy of Canada (NCC) directly protects and cares for our country's most vulnerable natural areas & the plants & animals they sustain.



Organization Overview



NCC is Canada's leading national land conservation organization. We are a private, non-profit group that partners with corporations, individuals, communities and government bodies to achieve the direct protection of our most important natural treasures. Since 1962, NCC and our partners have helped to conserve 14 million hectares (35 million acres) of ecologically significant land nationwide.
descriptionHTML:
Veiller sur l’environnement n’a jamais été aussi important qu’aujourd’hui. Conservation de la nature Canada (CNC) est à la recherche d’une ou d’un stagiaire en conservation motivé(e) pour se joindre à notre équipe qui œuvre à la protection de nos milieux naturels les plus précieux et des espèces animales et végétales qu’ils abritent.

Chef de file en conservation de terres privées au Canada et organisme sans but lucratif, Conservation de la nature Canada (CNC) œuvre à la protection de nos milieux naturels les plus précieux et des espèces qu’ils abritent. Depuis 1962, CNC et ses partenaires ont contribué à la protection de 15 millions d’hectares de terres de grande valeur écologique à travers le Canada. Grâce à son approche axée sur la science et sur la collaboration, CNC obtient des réussites en matière de conservation, au bénéfice de la nature et de la population. Comptant un bureau national situé à Toronto et des bureaux régionaux à travers le pays, CNC arrive à obtenir des résultats concrets.

Objectif et description générale :

La conservation de certains des milieux naturels les plus importants de la Saskatchewan vous passionne-t-elle? Voulez-vous avoir un impact positif et durable sur la nature? Cherchez-vous un poste bien équilibré pour lancer votre carrière dans le domaine de la conservation en acquérant une expérience pratique? Nous voulons vous rencontrer!

CNC est à la recherche d’une personne passionnée pour se joindre à l’équipe d’intendance de la Saskatchewan en tant que stagiaire en conservation. En étroite collaboration avec les coordonnateur(-trice)s de l’intendance de CNC, le ou la stagiaire aidera l’équipe d’intendance à mener des travaux sur le terrain à travers la province, à traiter les données de terrain et à rédiger des rapports. Il sera également possible de travailler en étroite collaboration avec des organisations partenaires, des intendants locaux et des bénévoles. Ce poste vise à offrir à un(e) jeune professionnel(le) un environnement stimulant et axé sur l’apprentissage.

Tâches et responsabilités :

Participer à une variété de travaux de terrain sur les sites de CNC à travers la Saskatchewan, y compris :

  • Classifier les écosystèmes en aidant à identifier les plantes (avec de l’aide);
  • Effectuer des inspections de sites pour vérifier les perturbations naturelles, le vandalisme, les intrusions, les menaces émergentes, les risques et les responsabilités;
  • Éliminer les espèces végétales envahissantes à l’aide de méthodes de contrôle manuelles et chimiques;
  • Contrôler les objectifs de biodiversité (p. ex., les espèces en péril, les communautés végétales) et les menaces (p. ex., les espèces envahissantes);
  • Entretien général de sites, y compris la surveillance de sentiers et l’installation de panneaux;
  • Saisie de données, analyse, recherche et établissement de rapports à l’aide de Microsoft Office et d’un système de base de données interne;
  • Aider à la gestion des bénévoles et des intendant(e)s des sites;
  • Aider au contrôle de la conformité des servitudes de conservation;
  • Assister/participer à des événements locaux;
  • Autres tâches assignées


Compétences et caractéristiques requises :

Ce poste s’adresse aux personnes qui possèdent les compétences suivantes :

  • Enthousiasme pour la conservation de la nature;
  • Adaptabilité/flexibilité dans les plans quotidiens;
  • Être à l’aise pour faire des randonnées ou travailler dans des régions sauvages éloignées sans sentiers (moustiques, tiques, etc.) pendant des périodes prolongées et sous des conditions météorologiques variables;
  • Aimer travailler en équipe, avoir le sens de l’humour, de la compassion, une bonne humeur et une attitude positive;
  • Communiquer de manière claire, professionnelle et réfléchie avec les propriétaires fonciers, le public et les collègues;
  • Fiable, ponctuel et responsable;
  • Volonté d’apprendre et de suivre les protocoles;
  • Personne motivée pouvant travailler de manière indépendante;
  • Excellent sens de l’organisation;
  • Maîtrise des logiciels utilisés pour la gestion de données et les feuilles de calcul;
  • Un travail physique sera nécessaire (p. ex. randonnée épuisante, transport d’un sac à dos lourd, etc.);
  • Permis de conduire valide de la classe 5 et aptitude à conduire sur des autoroutes et des routes accidentées.

Les compétences et aptitudes supplémentaires suivantes seraient des atouts pour ce poste, mais ne sont pas obligatoires pour postuler. Une formation sera dispensée par CNC pour développer ces compétences :

  • Connaissance de base des plantes, de la faune et des oiseaux;
  • Compétences en matière de navigation, y compris la compréhension des dispositifs ou applications GPS, de la boussole et de l’interprétation des photos aériennes;
  • Expérience en matière d’établissement de relations avec le public ou des bénévoles;
  • Premiers soins standard - Niveau C de la RCR ou certification de secourisme en région éloignée.

Conditions d’emploi :

Sous réserve de financement, il s'agit d’un poste de 16 semaines, du 6 mai 2024 au 26 août 2024;

  • Rémunération : 18,00 $/heure;
  • Ces postes seront basés à Regina ou à Saskatoon. Le ou la stagiaire sera responsable de son transport vers les bureaux de Regina et de Saskatoon lors des journées de travail sur le terrain.
  • Il peut être nécessaire de travailler le soir et la fin de semaine, mais cela est peu fréquent.
  • Les postes comprendront du « travail de bureau » qui pourra être effectué dans nos bureaux de Regina ou de Saskatoon, ou à domicile.


Pour poser votre candidature :

CNC est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à notre équipe, veuillez soumettre votre candidature par l’entremise de la page du Programme de stages en conservation de notre Centre des carrières.


Date limite :

22 mars 2024, 23 h 59 HNE, 21 h 59 HNR, 20 h 59 HAP, 22 h 50 HNC, 00 h 59 + +1 HNA.


CNC recrute sur la base du mérite et s’engage fermement en faveur de l’équité et de la diversité sur le lieu de travail. Nous nous efforçons de réaliser des projets de conservation audacieux dans lesquels l’équité, la diversité et l’inclusion (EDI) sont la norme. Nous acceptons les candidatures des personnes racialisées/des minorités visibles, des femmes, des autochtones, des personnes handicapées, des minorités ethniques et des personnes ayant une orientation sexuelle ou une identité de genre minoritaire, ainsi que celles de tous les candidats qualifiés possédant les compétences et les connaissances nécessaires pour s’engager de manière productive auprès de diverses communautés. CNC met en œuvre un programme d’équité en matière d’emploi et encourage les membres des groupes désignés à s’auto-identifier.

Des adaptations sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidat(e)s participant à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour une demande confidentielle, envoyez-nous un courriel au rh@conservationdelanature.ca pour prendre des dispositions. Si vous avez des questions concernant les emplois accessibles à CNC, veuillez envoyer un courriel à notre équipe au rh@conservationdelanature.ca.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Welcome! We are BASF and we are happy to see you are considering us as an employer of choice. We thought we would take a moment to introduce a bit about what we do! 

BASF Corporation, headquartered in Florham Park, New Jersey, is the North American affiliate of BASF SE, Ludwigshafen, Germany. BASF has approximately 16,700 employees in North America and had sales of $25.9 billion in 2021.

As one of the largest chemical companies in NA we have been finding solutions for your everyday needs and addressing the most complex economic, environmental, and sustainability challenges for more than 150 years!

We create chemistry for a sustainable future and we are already looking for the answers to tomorrow's questions, today. Our portfolio comprises six segments in which we develop innovative solutions together with our clients: Chemicals, Materials, Industrial Solutions, Surface Technologies, Nutrition & Care and Agricultural Solutions. 

This translates into the everyday products you interact with, such as the absorbents of your babies’ diapers, the coating on your car, the pigments of your makeup, the ingredients of your favorite snacks, the super comfy soles of your sneakers, and much more. 

At BASF we empower our employees with the tools, guidance and opportunities they need to advance and succeed in work and life. Giving you the support you need to be your best and fulfill your personal ambitions is what helps us create chemistry. After all, our success is linked to yours. Whatever path you envision, BASF is a great place to build a rewarding, successful career.
description:
Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You
  
  
  
    At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.
   
    We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.
   
    At BASF, we constantly strive to become an even better workplace. As a result of our commitment to our employees, BASF has earned various awards, including being recognized by Mediacorp as a Top Employer in Canada and the GTA in 2024, and for many consecutive years prior. We are also thrilled that, for the first time ever in 2023, we have been further recognized by Mediacorp as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Diversity, as well as for Young People.
   
    We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
   
    Summer Sales Intern (91400)
   
    Contract Duration: 4 months (Summer)
   
    Location: Regina, SK
   
    Wage: $22 – $29/hour
  
 
 
 
  
    Program Summary
  
  
  
    We offer students the opportunity to contribute to real-world assignments. This program also offers undergraduate students the ability to apply their education and background to challenging assignments to build both technical and professional skills.
    As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a 4 – 6-month internship located within Canada.
    
   
   
     Enhanced career development and value delivery to BASF. Throughout the internship, BASF will host learning events for personal and professional development and an opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company.
     Successfully engaging across the business throughout your internship will expand your network, allow you to grow personally and professionally, and learn a variety of valuable skill sets.
     All interns will be assessed throughout the summer for either a returning internship offer, or a full time offer for one of our Professional Development Rotational programs
     Your ability to be mobile will be critical as Sales locations vary.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Formula for Success: You Will…
  
  
  
    
   
     Manage and proactively call on a customer list of growers to drive BASF innovation and sales.
     Record and maintain customer information and sales progress.
     Support demonstration site tours and grower events.
     Lead field scale project and scout fields with influential growers to gain technical understanding of BASF product line.
     Communicate and collaborate with growers, retailers, and BASF staff to grow the business and enhance relationships within the industry.
     Must be able to travel within assigned Territory.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…
  
  
  
    
   
     Currently enrolled in an agriculture or related degree program.
     Passionate about the industry and looking to further their sales and business management skills.
     Excellent communication and organizational skills.
     Valid Driver‘s License.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
  
  
  
    BASF is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can be their authentic selves. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, place of origin, ethnic origin, colour, religion/creed, sex/pregnancy, marital status, family status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   
    We seek to make our recruitment process accessible for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process, please contact ta-canada@basf.com with the subject line “Recruitment Accommodation Request”.
  
 
 
  
    Privacy Statement
  
  
  
    BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request personal or financial information of any kind via either text message or direct message on any social media platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never offer a candidate a position and request a cheque for equipment or any other type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.

As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a 4 – 6-month internship located within Canada.


  • Enhanced career development and value delivery to BASF. Throughout the internship, BASF will host learning events for personal and professional development and an opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company.
  • Successfully engaging across the business throughout your internship will expand your network, allow you to grow personally and professionally, and learn a variety of valuable skill sets.
  • All interns will be assessed throughout the summer for either a returning internship offer, or a full time offer for one of our Professional Development Rotational programs
  • Your ability to be mobile will be critical as Sales locations vary.


Formula for Success: You Will…


  • Manage and proactively call on a customer list of growers to drive BASF innovation and sales.
  • Record and maintain customer information and sales progress.
  • Support demonstration site tours and grower events.
  • Lead field scale project and scout fields with influential growers to gain technical understanding of BASF product line.
  • Communicate and collaborate with growers, retailers, and BASF staff to grow the business and enhance relationships within the industry.
  • Must be able to travel within assigned Territory.


Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…


  • Currently enrolled in an agriculture or related degree program.
  • Passionate about the industry and looking to further their sales and business management skills.
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills.
  • Valid Driver‘s License.


Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment


BASF is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can be their authentic selves. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, place of origin, ethnic origin, colour, religion/creed, sex/pregnancy, marital status, family status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.


We seek to make our recruitment process accessible for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process, please contact ta-canada@basf.com with the subject line “Recruitment Accommodation Request”.

Privacy Statement


BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request personal or financial information of any kind via either text message or direct message on any social media platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never offer a candidate a position and request a cheque for equipment or any other type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.

description:
Legacy Co-op is hiring a Student and a Permanent Part-time Customer Service Clerks at the Kamsack Food Store in Kamsack, SK. 
 Who we are: 
 Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. We are pursuing a growth strategy that will provide you and our team with exciting opportunities. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.legacyco-op.crs 
 What you’ll do: 
 You will be responsible for delivering legendary service to make all guests of our Co-op feel “at home here” through: 
 
  Stocking – stock and face products within the store. 
  General Food Store duties - housekeeping, opening, closing. 
  Cashiering – processing transactions through the Point of Sale system including tobacco and lottery sales, when needed. 
 
 Why it matters: 
 Our team provides a range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build, fuel, feed and grow Western Canadian communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are interested in a career in customer service and: 
 
  You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-oriented and strive to be the best in what you do. 
  You are willing to work all shifts scheduled including days, evenings, holidays and weekends. 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
  You are physically able to do heavy lifting of 50 lbs, climb ladders and kneel. 
 
 All external applications must apply online through Legacy Co-op’s online job board https://bit.ly/LegacyCo-opCareers . 
 If you require assistance with your application, please contact Human Resources @ 306-783-0489/306-783-5054. 
 Our Team Members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We offer an excellent moving assistance program. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Part Time Gas Bar Clerk/Cashier at our C-Store/Gas Bar location in Debden, SK. 
 Who we are:  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to  customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To  learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs. 
 
  Reporting to the C-Store Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a 
  difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
   
  
   Provide legendary in-store and pump island service; serve guests, operate the point-of-sale system, stock shelves, face shelves, and 
  perform general housekeeping duties 
   
  
   Ensure safety is held as the highest priority 
   Maintain a neat, clean, and orderly location 
   Have a good working understanding of the point-of-sale system 
   Order, receive, price and display merchandise as required as specified by the team leader 
   Complete the necessary daily reconciliations and reports 
   Follow company policies and procedures and perform other duties as assigned 
  
 
 Why it matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities.  Through the work that we do and annual sales of $700 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in Retail Store Operations and Customer Service: 
   
  
   You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
   You are well organized and capable of attaining a high level of production with a minimum amount of supervision 
   You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different 
  perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
   
  
   You are attentive to detail and have strong cash management skills 
   You have an ability to fulfill the physical job requirements – standing, working inside and outside, lifting 20 to 25 pounds regularly 
   You have point-of-sale experience and can work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
   You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays 
  
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension  plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork  and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we  serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted. 
 ENERGY 2024-008
