companyInfo/companyDescription: Shoppers Drug Mart Corporation is a licensor of full-service retail drug stores operating under the name Shoppers Drug Mart® (Pharmaprix® in Québec). Founded in 1962 by Toronto pharmacist Murray Koffler, we have grown to a national network of more than 1,300 Shoppers Drug Mart/Pharmaprix stores across Canada.
description:
Join a locally owned and operated store to help deliver health, beauty and convenience services in your community, and keep the customer at the centre of everything you do.
  Why this role is important?
  SUMMARY:
  Join a locally owned and operated store to help deliver health, beauty and convenience services in your community, and keep the customer at the centre of everything you do.
 
  DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
   Pharmacy and Customer Service
   Acknowledge all customers approaching the Pharmacy
   Ensure all privacy requirements are met, including, customer confidentiality and consent management
   Be clearly identifiable to the public
 
 
  Why this role is important? Here at Shoppers Drug Mart, we take pride and ownership in helping Canadians live life well. We’re looking for talented individuals who are passionate about providing an exceptional shopping experience for our Pharmacy customers and delighting them every step of the way!
 
  We can offer progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility and a great benefits package! Come share our vision and passion in delivering a superior customer experience. Be a part of our growing Health & Wellness philosophy! We’re looking to provide practical experience for future pharmacists in a community pharmacy. Our retail / community environment will provide real world training to enhance academic experience. Interns will learn about the expanding roles of the community pharmacist.
 
  What we offer:
  Expose Interns to the practice of pharmacy in a community setting- Enhance communication skills with patients, employees, and other health care workers- Knowledge of OTC products, disease state management, drug therapy, and patient counseling skills- Teach skills necessary to manage a retail pharmacy- Prepare future pharmacists to be successful in a community setting. If you want to join a fast-paced winning team and believe you can have an immediate impact, then we want to hear from you.
 
  J2WRTL
  J2WRRX
 
  Why work in a Shoppers Drug Mart store?
  Each store has an Associate-Owner, so you will work for a local business owner while having the support of a national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, flexible and varied schedules, competitive pay and online learning through Academy.
  Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your patients, co-workers, customers and community.
 
  Associate Owners in the Shoppers Drug Mart network recognize Canada’s diversity as an opportunity to better serve their communities, and strive to reflect the nation’s evolving diversity in the products they sell, the people they hire, and the culture they create in their stores. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities. 
 
 In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Expose Interns to the practice of pharmacy in a community setting- Enhance communication skills with patients, employees, and other health care workers- Knowledge of OTC products, disease state management, drug therapy, and patient counseling skills- Teach skills necessary to manage a retail pharmacy- Prepare future pharmacists to be successful in a community setting. If you want to join a fast-paced winning team and believe you can have an immediate impact, then we want to hear from you.

J2WRTL

J2WRRX

Why work in a Shoppers Drug Mart store?

Each store has an Associate-Owner, so you will work for a local business owner while having the support of a national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, flexible and varied schedules, competitive pay and online learning through Academy.

Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your patients, co-workers, customers and community.

Associate Owners in the Shoppers Drug Mart network recognize Canada’s diversity as an opportunity to better serve their communities, and strive to reflect the nation’s evolving diversity in the products they sell, the people they hire, and the culture they create in their stores. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Genus is a world-leading animal genetics company. We partner with farmers to transform how we nourish the world – a mission that is important to a sustainable future. We do this by breeding better pigs and cattle, so farmers can produce high-quality meat and milk more efficiently and sustainably. 

We employ people across 30 countries, from geneticists to livestock technicians, veterinarians to accountants – and they all play important roles. We nurture collaboration between colleagues across businesses, roles and countries, every day. When you join Genus, you become part of a passionate, global team with a shared vision and strategy.
descriptionHTML:
Business Overview:

Genus strives to provide beef, dairy and pork producers with superior breeding stock to enable the production of affordable and nutritious animal protein for consumers. PIC is the swine division with a mission to pioneer animal genetic improvement to help nourish the world.


PIC currently supplies over 70% of the world’s top pork producers. We directly employ people in 18 countries worldwide and our products are available in more than 50 countries across the globe. We are a diverse team, ranging from scientists to sales teams, production personnel to customer service, and are all united by a passion for producing nutritious, affordable pork and a commitment to continuous improvement.

Genus s’efforce de fournir aux producteurs laitiers, de bœuf de boucherie et de porc un cheptel reproducteur de qualité supérieure pour permettre la production de protéines animales abordables et nutritives pour les consommateurs. PIC est la division porcine dont la mission est d’être à l’avant-garde en termes d’amélioration génétique animale pour aider à nourrir le monde.


PIC fournit actuellement plus de 70 % des plus producteurs de porc au monde. Nous avons des employés dans 18 pays à travers le monde et offrons nos produits dans plus de 50 pays. Nous sommes une équipe diversifiée, allant de scientifiques aux équipes commerciales, du personnel de production aux services aux clients. Nous sommes tous unis par la même passion de produire une viande nutritive et abordable et aussi par l’engagement de ne jamais cesser de s’améliorer.

Role Overview:

The PIC Internship program is focused on educating about the organization by focusing on daily routines and procedures. This role assists Production Technicians and Laboratory Technicians in routine animal care, laboratory compliance and general farm tasks to ensure the well-being of the animals and customer products.

Le programme de stages de PIC est axé sur l’éducation concernant l’organisation en mettant l’accent sur les routines et les procédures quotidiennes. Le stagiaire aide les techniciens de production et les techniciens de laboratoire à prodiguer des soins courants aux animaux, assurer la conformité des tâches à faire en laboratoire et à la ferme afin d’assurer le bien-être des animaux et la qualité des produits destinés aux clients.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Work as a team player by accomplishing daily department work requirements and farm goals
  • Daily animal husbandry tasks, including but not limited to:
    • Handling of boars and sire lines;
    • Collecting semen from boars;
    • Handling semen and preparing for laboratory transportation;
    • Taking temperatures of the boars and identifying those that are off feed, sick, etc.;
    • Preparation of insemination, including semen handling and task recordings;
    • Heat detections in sows and gilts;
    • Inseminating sows and gilts;
    • Working with weaned sows and gilts in all capacities;
    • Preparing for ear tag replacements writing up breeding notes;
    • Farrowing tasks (birthing active rooms, detecting signs of labor, crate cleanliness);
    • Days 1 – 3 piglet processing;
    • Castrations, ear tagging’s and tail dockings;
    • Weaning tasks (pre-wean vaccinations, wean movement preparation);
    • Nursing of sows;
    • Wean to finish pig placement;
    • Pig care;
    • Feed management;
    • Health and medication;
    • Environment, water management and ventilation;
    • Off testing, on testing and fit testing finisher pigs; and
    • Maintenance of production information and records
  • Assist with maintaining the barn environment
  • Adhere to the Company’s animal care policies and procedures including:
    • Providing a physical environment that meets the animal’s needs;
    • Providing access to adequate water and high-quality feed;
    • Providing humane treatment of the animals;
    • Providing identification and appropriate treatment of animals in need of health care; and
    • Following the guidelines for euthanasia
  • Abide by all company policies, procedures and guidelines as directed by farm leadership, including but not limited to:
    • The Company’s Safety Program, understanding all safety requirements of the job and performing the job in compliance with those safety requirements;
    • The Company’s bio-security protocols; and
    • All environmental laws and procedures as well as report all environmental issues immediately to supervisor

  • Travailler en équipe en accomplissant les tâches requises par le département pour rencontrer les objectifs de la ferme
  • Assurer les tâches de soins aux animaux, qui incluent et ne sont pas limités à :
  • Tâches quotidiennes d’élevage, notamment :
    • Gestion des verrats et lignées mâles;
    • Collecte de semence des verrats;
    • Manipulation de la semence et préparation pour le transport en laboratoire
    • Prendre la température des verrats et identifiés ceux qui doivent être nourris, qui sont malades, etc.;
    • Préparer l’insémination, incluant la manipulation de la semence et l’enregistrement de données;
    • Détection de chaleur chez les truies et les cochettes;
    • Insémination des truies et des cochettes;
    • Travailler avec les truies sevrées et les cochettes de toutes tailles
    • Préparation pour le remplacement des boucles d’oreille et remplir les fiches de reproduction;
    • Tâches en mise bas (assistance aux naissances dans des chambres actives, détection de signes de travail, propreté des cages de mise bas);
    • Tâches chez le porcelet du jour 1 au jour 3;
    • Castration, pose de boucles et coupe de queues;
    • Tâches au sevrage (vaccination pré-sevrage, préparation des mouvements de porcelets au sevrage)
    • Soins aux truies;
    • Transfert des porcs en pouponnière et en engraissement;
    • Soins aux porcelets et porcs à l’engrais;
    • Gestion de l’alimentation;
    • Santé et médication des animaux selon le besoin;
    • Gestion de l’environnement, des besoins en eau et en ventilation;
    • Mise des animaux en test de contrôle, évaluation en fin de test, évaluation de la résistance au stress; et
    • Maintien des registres de production et saisie des données;
  • Aider à au bon maintien de l’environnement dans les bâtiments
  • Respecter les politiques de l’entreprise en termes de soins aux animaux et procédures, qui incluent:
    • Fournir aux animaux un environnement physique qui rencontre les besoins de l’animal;
    • Procurer un accès adéquat à une eau et un aliment de haute qualité
    • Assurer un traitement sans cruautés aux animaux
    • Identification et traitements appropriés des animaux ayant besoin de soins de santé; et
    • Suivre les directives de l’entreprise en cas d’euthanasie
  • Respecter toutes les politiques, procédures et lignes directrices telles qu’édictées par les dirigeants de la ferme, notamment :
    • Le programme de sécurité au travail de la compagnie, comprendre toutes les exigences de sécurité au travail et exécuter les tâches conformément à ces exigences de sécurité;
    • Les protocoles de bio-sécurité de la compagnie; et
    • Les lois environnementales, les procédures, puis rapporter toute problématique environnementale immédiatement au superviseur.
Equal Employment Opportunities:
  • Currently enrolled in an Animal Science program
  • Ability to relocate to Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario or Quebec

  • Actuellement inscrit à un programme en Sciences Animales;
  • Prêt à être relocalisé en Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario et Québec.

description:
SRG Security Resource Group is looking for temporary/seasonal flaggers for the Co-op Refinery Complex Turnaround 2024. The hired group will provide additional traffic support throughout complex.
Positions will begin April 2024 and will continue until June.
Shifts are 3:00 pm to 7:00pm Monday through Saturday. Hours are fixed.
If you are motivated to learn and you enjoy a challenge, please feel free to submit an application.
Special Announcement: We will be hosting a Job Fair on Tuesday, February 20th, from 9 AM to 1 PM at 288F Hodsman Road. This event is a unique opportunity for applicants to attend with their resumes to be screened and interviewed for positions within our industrial security sector. The job fair is a limited-time event, offering a direct platform for you to showcase your skills, learn more about our organization, and potentially secure a position. We highly encourage those interested in advancing their career with us to join us at this event.
Job Types: Part-time, SeasonalContract length: 2 months
Salary: $25.00 per hour
Expected hours: 24 per week
Schedule:

 4 hour shift
 Evening shift

Application question(s):

 Are you willing to take the Flag Person Online Course?
 Do you have a reliable transportation to work? There are no nearby bus stops in this site.
 Are you willing to work Monday through Saturday, 3:00pm to 7:00pm? Our hours are fixed. If hired, can you commit?

Licence/Certification:

 Class 5 Drivers Licence (required)

Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024-03-10Expected start date: 2024-04-08

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien Ag Solutions is the retail division of Nutrien™, the largest crop inputs company in the world. As part of our collective mission of Feeding the Future, Nutrien Ag Solutions provides full-acre solutions through our trusted crop consultants at more than 2,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Australia. For more than 150 years, we have been helping growers achieve the highest yields with a wide selection of products, including our proprietary brands: Loveland Products, Inc.; Proven®Seed and Dyna-Gro®Seed; as well as financial, custom application and precision ag services.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien Ag Solutions will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be, and grow your career.
 
  This position is for a 2024 Summer Internship from May to August 2024.
  Agronomy-focused internship to learn the ins and out of a Nutrien Ag Solutions retail location. As a Retail Field Intern - Agronomy Assistant, you will assist our team of agronomists in providing full-acre solutions to our growers. This hands-on role offers a unique chance to apply your academic knowledge to real-world situations, playing a vital part in helping farmers achieve their highest yields.
 
  What you will do:
 
 
   Assist agronomists with crop scouting, soil sampling, and data collection
   Interpret data to provide recommendations on fertilizers, pesticides, and other crop inputs
   Assist with the planning and execution of field days and grower meetings
   Maintain strong relationships with growers and internal teams
   Execute our culture of care and comply with all Nutrien Ag Solutions’ and industry regulatory and EH&S standards.
 
 
  What you will bring:
 
 
   Currently enrolled in a 2 or 4-year higher education degree program in Agriculture or a related program with an interest in Agriculture
   Must have a graduation date of December 2024 or later
   Must possess a valid Canadian driver’s license
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
  Nutrien Ag Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

For more than 150 years, we have been helping growers achieve the highest yields with a wide selection of products, including our proprietary brands: Loveland Products, Inc.; Proven®Seed and Dyna-Gro®Seed; as well as financial, custom application and precision ag services.

This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
BHP is a world-leading resources company. Our corporate purpose is to bring people and resources together to build a better world. We do this through our strategy: to have the best capabilities, best commodities and best assets, to create long-term value and high returns. We are among the world’s top producers of major commodities, including iron ore, metallurgical coal and copper. We also have substantial interests in oil, gas and energy coal.

With more than 80,000 employees and contractors, working across 90 locations worldwide, our people sit at the very heart of everything we do. At BHP, we are focused on creating a safe workplace where our people feel connected to our values and objectives and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

True to our purpose, we are committed to providing a safe, inclusive and diverse workplace; this commitment is embedded in Our Charter because we know it’s critical to our success. Local Inclusion and Diversity Council’s operate in our Asset’s and offices around the globe, following the same priorities. Our people are the driving force behind bringing our aspirational goal to achieve gender balance by 2025 to life. By aspiring for gender balance, we will create a safer, more harmonious culture. We want BHP to be a place where everyone is respected and valued and want it to be an enjoyable and inclusive place to work.

We're changing things up by asking everyone what their ‘flex’ looks like so we can create new definitions of flexibility where traditionally there has been none. We’ve found this to be the single biggest driver in helping us to promote greater workforce diversity – and that’s why it continues to be a key focus for BHP.

In addition to having the right assets in the right commodities, we also create value in the way we operate our assets. Our Operating Model allows us to leverage integrated systems and technology, replicate expertise and apply high standards of governance and transparency. 

We love new opinions and innovative ideas. It's the unique experiences and perspectives of our teams that will lead us into the future we're trying to create. We have tremendously talented people at BHP, but our teams are always looking for smarter and more agile ways of doing things to get there faster. Not to mention we have some great leaders here focused on supporting our next great leaders.
description:
Date: 24 Feb 2024 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Posting End Date: 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Country: Canada 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job State/Province: Saskatchewan 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Location/Region: Saskatoon
    
   
  
 
 


 
  About BHP 
 
 
  At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills, and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.
 
  
  
 
  Come and be a part of this success!
   
 
 
  About Potash
  
 
  The Jansen project in Saskatchewan, Canada is set to become one of the largest potash mines in the world and is located approximately 140 kilometers east of Saskatoon.
 
  
 
   BHP’s CAD$14 billion (US$10.5 billion) investment in the Jansen project will deliver a potash mine in Saskatchewan designed to maximize sustainability. As the largest investment in Saskatchewan’s history, Jansen is expected to generate approximately 5,500 workforce opportunities during construction and 900 long-term roles.
 
  
 
   Jansen's construction will take place over several years with first production planned for late 2026. Once fully ramped up, Jansen is expected to have an initial production capacity of approximately 8.5 million tonnes per annum (Mtpa), with the potential to produce 16 to 17 Mtpa in future stages.
 
  
 
 
  Potash at BHP: Enriched by our experiences
 
  
  
 
  Purpose 
 
 
  Our purpose is to bring people and resources together to build a better world. This is why we exist as a company and at the heart of this is our people. At BHP, our people work together to learn and embrace new ways to discover their potential and we always put the health and safety of our people first. The history of BHP has shown that teams that are more inclusive and diverse deliver safety benefits, have a better culture and are more productive than other teams. This is an amazing opportunity for a dynamic individual to be a part of something big to work with an innovative, diverse, global team, with evolving and new technology, and playing a pivotal role in building a world class mine and potential new resource pillar for BHP.
 
  
  
 
  Here at BHP Potash, we provide various student work opportunities within our organization. We are eager to hear from driven Canadian students seeking outstanding opportunities to enhance their student work experiences. We highly encourage students studying Engineering, Computer Science, and Business to apply to these positions. Only those students returning to their program after the completion of their work term will qualify.
 
  
  
 
  About the Roles 
 
 
  Applies an understanding of engineering-, business-, technology-related terminology, key processes, and activities. 
  Employs specific/relevant discipline expertise and leadership to meet BHP's technical expectations, i.e. 
   
    Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Mining/Geological, Electrical, Environmental, etc.) 
    Business (Accounting, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Marketing, Finance, etc.) 
    Technology (Software Development, Cybersecurity, System Programmer, Network Administrator, Infrastructure Architect, etc.) 
    Geosciences (Earth Science, Geology, Geophysics, Environmental Geoscience, etc.) 
   
  Assesses change impacts to prepare integrated change management plans, manages change readiness and resistance, and upskills leaders and impacted stakeholders in the adoption and successful delivery of the change. 
  Determines the underlying cause of problems and evaluates multiple solutions to ensure a planned and structured approach to solving complex problems. 
  Identifies, engages, and manages a range of diverse internal and external stakeholders. 
  Identifies and assesses risks, makes risk informed decisions, uses BHP's risk management framework, and builds a risk aware culture to support safe and productive performance outcomes. Sources information, plans and conducts analyses to support evidence-based decision making. 
 
 
  Work Locations
  
 
  These positions are located at either our Saskatoon office and/or Jansen site. The work schedule for these positions is generally 40 hours per week (Monday – Friday). Hybrid working (flexible, shared workstations and a combination of office and work from home) is standard for BHP.
 
  
  
 
  About You
  
 
  Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal skills required. 
  Have a growth mindset and learning agility. 
  Understand stakeholder priorities. 
  Collaborate with key decision makers across the organization to support change. 
  Attention to detail and strong commitment to BHP’s values/purpose. 
  Professional verbal and written communications. 
  Strong initiative and ability to work unsupervised. 
  Ability to travel domestically as needed.
 
  
  
 
 
  Supporting a Diverse Workforce
  
 
  At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that is more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognize that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.
 
  
 
   BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.
 
  
 
   At BHP, we aim to unlock the enormous potential that diverse and inclusive teams bring to the workplace, to leave a strong legacy within and beyond our operations for the generations to come.
 
  
 
   Based on existing demographics in our Potash project preference in hiring will be given to qualified women and Indigenous peoples who self-identify as such in the application process. This reasonable and justifiable measure has been implemented pursuant to section 56 of The Saskatchewan Human Rights Code, 2018.
 
  
 
   The BHP Jansen project marks the largest investment in Saskatchewan’s history, and with that growth will come significant employment opportunities. With first production projected to occur late in 2026, from now until the project fully ramps up there will be significant recruitment requirements over the coming months and years. To find out more about the project, hints and tips on our process, and where a career with BHP Potash can take you, sign up to our talent updates here.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce
At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that is more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognize that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.


BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.


At BHP, we aim to unlock the enormous potential that diverse and inclusive teams bring to the workplace, to leave a strong legacy within and beyond our operations for the generations to come.


Based on existing demographics in our Potash project preference in hiring will be given to qualified women and Indigenous peoples who self-identify as such in the application process. This reasonable and justifiable measure has been implemented pursuant to section 56 of The Saskatchewan Human Rights Code, 2018.


The BHP Jansen project marks the largest investment in Saskatchewan’s history, and with that growth will come significant employment opportunities. With first production projected to occur late in 2026, from now until the project fully ramps up there will be significant recruitment requirements over the coming months and years. To find out more about the project, hints and tips on our process, and where a career with BHP Potash can take you, sign up to our talent updates here.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Established and growing Canadian trucking company. Our vision is to operate a disciplined company is transport sector. As we grow, we always focus on providing adequate and honest service to our customers. We will continue to provide our customers with confidence in our services. All of our company staff respects and treats everyone with integrity and respect. 
Denali transport runs with equipment under 2 years old on average to diminish the down time on the road so that our drivers are safe and confident and we keep our promise to customers for delivering the goods on time.
description:
Responsibilities:
- Book truck loads by contacting customers and using online software.- Receive and prioritize incoming calls from customers and drivers- Dispatch drivers to appropriate locations based on customer requests and delivery schedules- Monitor driver progress and provide updates to customers as needed- Enter data accurately into the transportation management system- Coordinate with shipping and receiving departments to ensure timely delivery of goods- Analyze supply chain data to optimize routes and improve efficiency- Communicate effectively with drivers, customers, and other team members- Utilize phone systems and other communication tools to relay information
Requirements:
- Proficient in email writing and good communication skills.
- Must be a team player and cooperative.
- Must have basic knowledge of transportation.
Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may be required to perform other duties as assigned by their supervisor.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Internship / Co-op
Salary: $14.00-$25.00 per hour
Benefits:

 On-site parking

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
descriptionHTML:
Responsibilities:

- Book truck loads by contacting customers and using online software.
- Receive and prioritize incoming calls from customers and drivers
- Dispatch drivers to appropriate locations based on customer requests and delivery schedules
- Monitor driver progress and provide updates to customers as needed

- Analyze supply chain data to optimize routes and improve efficiency
- Communicate effectively with drivers, customers, and other team members
- Utilize phone systems and other communication tools to relay information

- Proficient in email writing and good communication skills.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full Time Sales Agronomist at our Whitestar Agro Location in Prince Albert, SK. 
 
 Who we are: 
 Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 
 Reporting to the Whitestar Agro Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Engage and interact with members and guests to create a positive experience- in person, on the telephone and at the point of sale 
  Sales of crop inputs, nutrition products and farm equipment through the development of customer and supplier relationships 
  Field scouting and the collection of soil samples 
  Make chemical and agronomic recommendations, showcase equipment and complete follow-up calls 
  Receive, distribute and load fertilizer and crop protection products 
  Maintain environmental compliance 
  Maintain inventory control, ordering and data reporting through in house programming 
  Adhere to all merchandising standards, marketing efforts including pricing, policy and procedure, equipment maintenance, house-keeping and loss prevention policies. 
 
 Why it Matters: 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $675 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Agriculture and Customer Service: 
 
  You hold an Ag Degree or Diploma and are eligible for membership in the SIA; you have CCA or Pag or equivalent or are willing to obtain 
  You’re well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
  You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-orientated, and strive to be the best in what you do 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
  You must have the ability to work in a fast -paced environment 
  You must have superior customer service and interpersonal skills You have a flexible work schedule including seasonal peaks 
 
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work 
 rebecca.craig@lakecountrycoop.ca | Phone: 306-953-2061 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the positions of Full Time Gas Bar Clerk with Supervisory Duties (2 positions) at our Choiceland Corner location in Choiceland, SK. 
 Who we are:  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 
  Reporting to the C-Store Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Demonstrate the day-to-day behaviors and actions that align with and strengthen Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, brand and focus on safety 
   Provide Legendary pump island and in-store service; serve guests, dispense fuel and propane, operate the point-of-sale system, stock shelves, face shelves, and perform general housekeeping duties 
   Effectively and efficiently direct the work of others on supervisory shifts 
   Ensure safety is held as the highest priority 
   Ensure legendary guest service is delivered at all times 
   Maintain a neat, clean, and orderly location at all times 
   Complete the necessary daily reconciliations and reports with responsibility of opening and closing the store 
   Have a good working understanding of the point-of-sale system, pumps, propane 
   Follow company policies and procedures and perform other duties as assigned 
  
 
 Why it matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $700 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in Customer Service: 
   
  
   You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-orientated, and strive to be the best in what you do 
   You are able to work unsupervised, plan and organize your own work and the work of others 
   You’re attentive to detail and have strong cash management skills 
   You have an ability to fulfill physical job requirements – standing, working inside and outside, lifting 20 to 25 pounds regularly 
   You have experience with C-Store/Gas Bar operations, Ag and Farm hardware, feed, lubricants, and general merchandise 
   You have POS experience and can work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
   You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings, and holidays 
   You must be willing to obtain WHMIS, propane dispensing, and PMEO certifications 
  
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 Phone: 306-953-2061 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  Discover more about potash at Nutrien! An exciting co-op opportunity awaits a motivated student at our Saskatoon location beginning May 2024 for a 16-month term. This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position open to current students who will be returning to their studies once this work term is complete. This position is not available for remote work.
  What you will do:
 
  
    Equipment failure data integration from multiple sources such as enterprise databases, historians and web-based 3rd party data sources
   Equipment failure data analysis, including cleansing, validation, prioritization, and identification of improvement opportunities
   Collaborate with and receive coaching and support from experienced reliability engineers
  
 
 
  What you will bring:
 
  
    Currently enrolled in a 2-to-4 year Mechanical Engineering degree or equivalent related program with a graduation date of Aug 2024 or later
  
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.


Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.


We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.


Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.


Discover more about potash at Nutrien! An exciting co-op opportunity awaits a motivated student at our Saskatoon location beginning May 2024 for a 16-month term. This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position open to current students who will be returning to their studies once this work term is complete. This position is not available for remote work.


What you will do:


  • Equipment failure data integration from multiple sources such as enterprise databases, historians and web-based 3rd party data sources
  • Equipment failure data analysis, including cleansing, validation, prioritization, and identification of improvement opportunities

What you will bring:

Are you a good match? Apply today!


The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.


Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.


This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription: WSP is one of the world's leading engineering and professional services consulting firms. We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower. We are technical experts and strategic advisors that include engineers, technicians, scientists, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals. We design lasting solutions in the Buildings, Transportation, Infrastructure, Oil & Gas, Environment, Geomatics, Mining, Power and Industrial sectors as well as in project delivery and strategic consulting services. With over 8,000 talented people across Canada and 43,000 globally, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for generations to come.
descriptionHTML:
The Opportunity:

WSP is seeking a Co-op Engineering Student to join our Land Development & Municipal Engineering department for the Summer 2024 Term . Reporting to the Manager, Land Development and Municipal Engineering – Saskatchewan, this position will be responsible for supporting field and office services for land development projects for residential, commercial and industrial subdivisions, municipal design, and related roadway projects.

A day in the life:

  • Assist with field surveying using GPS and Total Station;
  • Assist with preparing reports;
  • Undertake field reviews and complete reporting;
  • Prepare and review drawings; and
  • Site inspections and field work required;
  • Travel may be required to specific project locations in the Province; and
  • Other duties as assigned

What you'll bring to WSP ...

  • Enrolled in a Bachelors program (Civil Engineer or Environmental Systems Engineering) program from an accredited post-secondary institution;
  • Have an interest in the design, contract administration and project management of municipal engineering and land development projects;
  • Working knowledge of one or more of the following: AutoCAD, Civil 3D; and
  • Great communication skills, both verbal and written.
positionName: Civil Engineering Co-op Student, Land Development and Municipal Engineering - Saskatchewan

description:
Prairie North Co-op is hiring an Agro Summer Student at our Agro Centre located in Naicam, Saskatchewan. 
 Who we are:  With home office based out of Melfort, Saskatchewan, Prairie North Co-op is proud to serve our 20 site locations in the communities of Archerwill, Kelvington, Melfort, Naicam, Spalding, St. Brieux and Rose Valley. Through living our values of Integrity, Service and Unity our Vision is to be trusted first choice in the communities we serve. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.prairienorthcoop.crs 
 What you'll do:  Reporting to the Agro Area Manager, the Agronomist Summer Student provides basic agronomic information and advice on seed, pest identification, crop protection, and crop nutrient/fertilizer so local co-op customers can make informed decisions based on reported findings. Additional responsibilities include: 
 
  Perform field scouting, agronomic troubleshooting, crop planning, fertility, and crop protection recommendations 
  Maintain knowledge of current industry best practices and trends 
  Support senior team members in executing transactions and operational duties 
  Communicate effectively with senior team members to ensure inventory is in place to match demand 
 
 
  Who you are: 
   
  
   You are pursuing a degree in agriculture and are motivated to gain industry experience 
   You're honest and trustworthy, are results-oriented and strive to be the best in what you do 
   You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most 
   Have a valid drivers license 
   Willing to travel throughout the trading area to support our customers and business
descriptionHTML:
Prairie North Co-op is hiring an Agro Summer Student at our Agro Centre located in Naicam, Saskatchewan.

Who we are:
With home office based out of Melfort, Saskatchewan, Prairie North Co-op is proud to serve our 20 site locations in the communities of Archerwill, Kelvington, Melfort, Naicam, Spalding, St. Brieux and Rose Valley. Through living our values of Integrity, Service and Unity our Vision is to be trusted first choice in the communities we serve. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.prairienorthcoop.crs

What you'll do:
Reporting to the Agro Area Manager, the Agronomist Summer Student provides basic agronomic information and advice on seed, pest identification, crop protection, and crop nutrient/fertilizer so local co-op customers can make informed decisions based on reported findings. Additional responsibilities include:

  • Perform field scouting, agronomic troubleshooting, crop planning, fertility, and crop protection recommendations
  • Maintain knowledge of current industry best practices and trends
  • Support senior team members in executing transactions and operational duties
  • Communicate effectively with senior team members to ensure inventory is in place to match demand
Who you are:
  • You are pursuing a degree in agriculture and are motivated to gain industry experience
  • You're honest and trustworthy, are results-oriented and strive to be the best in what you do
  • You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most
  • Have a valid drivers license
  • Willing to travel throughout the trading area to support our customers and business

companyInfo/companyDescription:
With more than 30 offices across the country and over 2,600 employees, 60% of which share ownership in the company, CIMA+ is one of Canada’s largest private consulting engineering firms and a “Best Employer” according to the Kincentric survey. 

For more than 30 years, our multidisciplinary teams have been offering clients a complete range of solutions in the building, energy and resources, municipal infrastructure, telecommunications and transportation sectors. We also offer a multitude of complementary services, including environmental and project management services. Innovative and integrated solutions that place people at the centre of engineering, reflect our values and our corporate culture.
description:
Company Description
  Welcome to a place where people are at the heart of everything we do.  Welcome to people who like people, to brilliant minds, tomorrow’s visionaries, challenge seekers, collaborators, and those with an entrepreneurial spirit in their DNA.  At CIMA+ you’ll find a place where everyone’s ideas and perspectives are welcomed and encouraged, a place where you’ll have many opportunities to learn and develop while working on projects that rally our team together.  At the end of the day, we’re proud to be able to say that when you join CIMA+, we’ll welcome you into a place that you can call home. Welcome to a place where your skills and passion can reach their full potential. Job Description
  Mission
  CIMA+ is looking for a Co-op Student to join our Transportation team in Saskatoon. This role will require the candidate to perform engineering field services, design, and planning for urban & rural roadway and drainage projects in Saskatchewan.
  The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic and motivated individual who will work closely with our team of professional and technical staff in the delivery of design and construction projects for various public and private-sector clients. Industry experience will be considered an asset, but not a requirement. At CIMA+, we are dedicated to fostering the growth of our team members. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to achieve professional growth though hands-on-training and mentoring within our collaborative and supportive team environment.
  Primary Responsibilities
 
   Support the design and construction of civil engineering projects, including roadways, bridges and culverts
   Conduct field surveys and investigations related to roadway geometry, safety and drainage
   Perform topographic surveys for design projects
   Perform layout surveys for construction projects
   Administer and report on the construction of roadway, bridge and culvert projects
   Prepare memos related to roadway geometry, safety and drainage
   Use and understand the functionality of AutoCAD and Civil 3D software
   Aid in the development of design drawings and calculations
   Participate in Health, Safety, and Environment initiatives
 
   Qualifications
  
 
   Student in Civil Engineering Technologies
   Interest or experience in highway/freeway design and/or (e.g. alignments, geometrics, staging, utilities, quantities and cost estimates, documentation)
   Experience in the use of GPS and conventional survey equipment is an asset
   Experience in the use of AutoCAD and Civil 3D is an asset
   Knowledge of Saskatchewan Ministry of Highways and City of Saskatoon design and drafting standards is an asset
   Ability to, at times, work for periods in the field away from the office
   Ability to lift 20 kilograms
   Valid Class 5 driver’s license
 
   Additional Information
 
  Ethics and integrity are fundamental values at CIMA+. That is why we are committed to ensuring equal access to resources and opportunities for candidates, regardless of their identity (race, ethnicity, colour, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, socio-economic status or background, etc.). 
 In keeping with the principles of employment equity, we encourage all applications, including, but not limited to, those from women, Indigenous people, people with disabilities and visible minorities. We also encourage candidates to complete the self-identification form when applying for employment. 
 Accommodations are available on request. Your Business Partner will process your request.
descriptionHTML:
Company Description


Welcome to a place where people are at the heart of everything we do.

Welcome to people who like people, to brilliant minds, tomorrow’s visionaries, challenge seekers, collaborators, and those with an entrepreneurial spirit in their DNA.

At CIMA+ you’ll find a place where everyone’s ideas and perspectives are welcomed and encouraged, a place where you’ll have many opportunities to learn and develop while working on projects that rally our team together.

At the end of the day, we’re proud to be able to say that when you join CIMA+, we’ll welcome you into a place that you can call home. Welcome to a place where your skills and passion can reach their full potential.


Job Description


Mission

CIMA+ is looking for a Co-op Student to join our Transportation team in Saskatoon. This role will require the candidate to perform engineering field services, design, and planning for urban & rural roadway and drainage projects in Saskatchewan.

The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic and motivated individual who will work closely with our team of professional and technical staff in the delivery of design and construction projects for various public and private-sector clients. Industry experience will be considered an asset, but not a requirement. At CIMA+, we are dedicated to fostering the growth of our team members. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to achieve professional growth though hands-on-training and mentoring within our collaborative and supportive team environment.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Support the design and construction of civil engineering projects, including roadways, bridges and culverts
  • Conduct field surveys and investigations related to roadway geometry, safety and drainage
  • Perform topographic surveys for design projects
  • Perform layout surveys for construction projects
  • Administer and report on the construction of roadway, bridge and culvert projects
  • Prepare memos related to roadway geometry, safety and drainage
  • Use and understand the functionality of AutoCAD and Civil 3D software
  • Aid in the development of design drawings and calculations
  • Participate in Health, Safety, and Environment initiatives

Qualifications
  • Student in Civil Engineering Technologies
  • Interest or experience in highway/freeway design and/or (e.g. alignments, geometrics, staging, utilities, quantities and cost estimates, documentation)
  • Experience in the use of GPS and conventional survey equipment is an asset
  • Experience in the use of AutoCAD and Civil 3D is an asset
  • Knowledge of Saskatchewan Ministry of Highways and City of Saskatoon design and drafting standards is an asset
  • Ability to, at times, work for periods in the field away from the office
  • Ability to lift 20 kilograms
  • Valid Class 5 driver’s license

Additional Information


Ethics and integrity are fundamental values at CIMA+. That is why we are committed to ensuring equal access to resources and opportunities for candidates, regardless of their identity (race, ethnicity, colour, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, socio-economic status or background, etc.).

In keeping with the principles of employment equity, we encourage all applications, including, but not limited to, those from women, Indigenous people, people with disabilities and visible minorities. We also encourage candidates to complete the self-identification form when applying for employment.

Accommodations are available on request. Your Business Partner will process your request.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  Discover more about potash at Nutrien! An exciting co-op opportunity awaits a motivated student at our Saskatoon location beginning May 2024 for a 16-month term. This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position open to current students who will be returning to their studies once this work term is complete. This position is not available for remote work.
 
  What you will do:
  
 
 
   Work with ETC group in collecting drawings from Nutrien’s sites and organizing those drawings as per Structural Integrity Program Requirements
   Assist Nutrien sites with structural data collection
   Assist in performing structural inspections, preparing reports, and producing sketches and drawings
 
 
  What you will bring:
  
 
 
   Currently enrolled in a Structural, Civil or related degree program
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

description:
Position Summary 
This position is responsible for cleaning heavy equipment and light vehicles in the wash bay. 
Duties & Responsibilities 

 
 Operate a large variety of equipment to move it in and out of the wash bay. 
 Use a pressurized water hose to wash equipment and vehicles prior to maintenance work. 
 Change soap barrels and nozzles for pressure washer as required. 
 Keep the wash bay organized and clean of mud and debris. 
 Clean, roll, and return wash hoses to the hangers. 
 Inspect wash bay grates and sump levels and report any concerns. 
 Operate support equipment such as forklift and skidsteer. 
 Other duties as assigned. 
 Qualifications 

 
 High school diploma or equivalency certificate. 
 Currently enrolled in post-secondary education and returning to post-secondary education in the fall. 
 Valid Class 5 driver’s license. 
 Ability to work 12-hour shifts, rotating days and nights. 
 Employment will start at the beginning of May and conclude at the end of August. 
This position currently follows a 28-day shift rotation working 12-hour day and night shifts from 6:00 to 6:00. The shift rotation is: 3 days, 2 off, 2 nights, 3 off, 2 days, 2 off, 3 nights, 2 off, 2 days, 3 off, 2 nights, 2 off. 
The Estevan Mine is located approximately 12 km from the city of Estevan and 16 km from the town of Bienfait. The successful candidate will be responsible for his/her own accommodations and transportation.

companyInfo/companyDescription: WSP is one of the world's leading engineering and professional services consulting firms. We are dedicated to our local communities and propelled by international brainpower. We are technical experts and strategic advisors that include engineers, technicians, scientists, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals. We design lasting solutions in the Buildings, Transportation, Infrastructure, Oil & Gas, Environment, Geomatics, Mining, Power and Industrial sectors as well as in project delivery and strategic consulting services. With over 8,000 talented people across Canada and 43,000 globally, we engineer projects that will help societies grow for generations to come.
description:
RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
  Supporting our Electrical Engineering Team, we are looking for a self-motivated team member to help assist with projects 
  Assist with project related duties, this may include review of electrical designs and drawings field data collection, analysis, design, co-ordination of resources within the department 
  Prepare design drawings, sketches, calculations. technical reports and papers 
  Assist in providing technical advice to clients and project teams (consultants and contractors) 
  Manage multiple priorities 
  Make contributions to company knowledge management and practice systems 
  Learn and excel through daily project work Other duties as assigned/required. 
 
 
 QUALIFICATIONS 
 
  1 st or 2 nd year technology program student eligible to participate in the co-op program 
  Excellent academic record 
  Knowledge of Autodesk Revit software is an asset 
  Ability to quickly identify and understand project issues and opportunities 
  A team player who thrives on working with other successful, energetic people 
  Excellent communicator, with strong verbal, written, and presentation skills 
  Good initiative, attention to detail

companyInfo/companyDescription: Saputo produces, markets, and distributes a wide array of dairy products of the utmost quality, including cheese, fluid milk, extended shelf-life milk and cream products, cultured products, and dairy ingredients. Saputo is one of the top ten dairy processors in the world, a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada, and the top dairy processor in Australia and Argentina. In the USA, Saputo ranks among the top three cheese producers and is one of the largest producers of extended shelf-life and cultured dairy products. In the United Kingdom, Saputo is the largest manufacturer of branded cheese and a top manufacturer of dairy spreads. In addition to its dairy portfolio, Saputo produces, markets, and distributes a range of dairy alternative cheeses and beverages. Saputo products are sold in several countries under market-leading brands, as well as private label brands. Saputo Inc. is a publicly traded company and its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol “SAP”.
description:
At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.
 
 
 
  
   
     Our best comes from our people—their expertise, talents and passion. As our industry continues to evolve, and we serve more customers around the world, it’s our people who drive our success as a leading global dairy processor. The Intern, Transport will perform analysis and research of existing freight operations with a focus on service improvement, productivity improvements and cost control. the Intern is responsible for data gathering and analysis, process mapping, time studies and simulation of results. This opportunity will support operational decision making, project management, and contribute to service delivery and cost improvements to support our customer promise.
   
  
  
  
   
     The Internship Program will begin on May 13th and end August 16th, 2024.
   
  
  
  
   
     AT SAPUTO, YOU WILL…
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Write the future of the industry – We’re a leading global dairy processor because we’ve always been passionate and optimistic about solving the challenges we face. At Saputo, you will work alongside a committed team that continues to find better and more efficient answers that shape the future of our industry.
     
   
  
  
  
   
    
     
       Have an impact on day one – Being hands-on is part of our culture. From your first day, you’ll contribute to our success, because we tap into the talents of each and every one of our employees.
     
   
  
  
  
   
    
     
       Grow in your own way – We know that everyone’s growth path looks a little different. As you progress in your internship, you’ll discover opportunities for you to grow and build your own career path.
     
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
     HOW YOU WILL MAKE CONTRIBUTIONS THAT MATTER...
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Identify and implement cost savings and cost avoidance opportunities
     
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Track, analyze, and optimize freight movements. Identify gaps and support the development of improved routing configurations.
     
    
     
       Assist with continuous improvement projects
     
   
  
  
  
   
     YOU ARE BEST SUITED FOR THE ROLE IF YOU...
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain or related field (you have at least completed the second year);
     
    
     
       Are active in extracurricular activities on campus or in the community;
     
    
     
       Have previous related internship experience (an asset);
     
    
     
       Are detail-oriented, analytical, self-motivated and willing to take initiative;
     
    
     
       Ability to model operational problems effectively;
     
    
     
       Are not afraid to get acquainted with your team and business partners, quickly building relationships;
     
    
     
       Bilingual (English/French), both spoken and written – will interact with partners across Canada
     
    
     
       Have strong time management and organizational skills: you will manage priorities and multiple projects at a time all while ensuring to meet deadlines.
     
   
  
  
  
   
     We support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.
   
  
 
 
 
   Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montréal. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise.
 
 
 
   Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day!
 
 
 
  SCOTSBURN is a registered trademark and is used under license by Saputo Dairy Products Canada G.P.
 
 
 
   The material contained herein is provided for informational purposes only. All open jobs offered by Saputo Inc. and all companies, corporations, partnerships, limited partnerships and other entities controlled by Saputo Inc. (collectively, “Saputo”) on Saputo's web site are subject to specific job skill requirements. The job skill requirements, qualifications, and preferred experience are determined by a Saputo subsidiary, office or department, and all positions are subject to local prevailing employment laws and restrictions. This would include immigration laws pertaining to work authorization requirements and any other applicable government permissions or compliance. The materials on this site are provided without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties regarding the accuracy or completeness of the information contained on this site or in any referenced links. While Saputo attempts to update this site on a timely basis, the information is effective only as of the time and date of posting. Strict confidentiality will be observed at all times. Saputo is an equal opportunity employer. The information on this site is for information purposes only and is not intended to be relied upon with legal consequence.
 
 
 
   Saputo welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations may be available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
