description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full Time Bakery Clerk (Baker) at our Food Store in La Ronge, SK . 
 Who we are: 
 Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back, and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs . Reporting to the Bakery Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members’ lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Properly prepare products prior to baking, bake products to Co-op standards, package and label finished products, decorate and frost cakes and other baked goods, and maintain production records 
  Operate bakery ovens and execute maintenance of associated equipment, monitor case temperatures, and clean and sanitize workspaces and equipment according to schedule 
  Maintain and display all types of bakery products according to department standards 
  Measure and combine ingredients and use mixers, heat sources, and other equipment to make baked goods 
  Continually monitor code dates to ensure the freshest inventory on the shelf; follow First In, First Out 
  Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience 
  Record cake and bakery product special orders accurately 
  Be familiar with and adhere to sanitation, food safety, and personal hygiene legislation and policies 
  Perform other duties as assigned 
 Why it matters: 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our over 54,000 member owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do, and annual sales of over $650 million, we help to build, fuel, feed, and grow our communities together. Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in retail Bakery and Customer Service and: 
 
  You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
  You are well organized and capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
  You are familiar with Food Safe procedures and practices; baking and cake decorating experience is an asset 
  You possess knowledge of general baking principles and understanding of recipes 
  You can lift and load products; extensive physical labor is required 
  You are available for a flexible work schedule; weekend and evening work is required 
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth.  You are looking for a career in Customer Service: 
 
  You have a grade 12 or equivalent experience; customer service experience is an asset

  You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-orientated, and strive to be the best in what you do 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
  You’re attentive to detail and have strong cash management skills 
  You have POS experience and have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment

 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Welcome! We are BASF and we are happy to see you are considering us as an employer of choice. We thought we would take a moment to introduce a bit about what we do! 

BASF Corporation, headquartered in Florham Park, New Jersey, is the North American affiliate of BASF SE, Ludwigshafen, Germany. BASF has approximately 16,700 employees in North America and had sales of $25.9 billion in 2021.

As one of the largest chemical companies in NA we have been finding solutions for your everyday needs and addressing the most complex economic, environmental, and sustainability challenges for more than 150 years!

We create chemistry for a sustainable future and we are already looking for the answers to tomorrow's questions, today. Our portfolio comprises six segments in which we develop innovative solutions together with our clients: Chemicals, Materials, Industrial Solutions, Surface Technologies, Nutrition & Care and Agricultural Solutions. 

This translates into the everyday products you interact with, such as the absorbents of your babies’ diapers, the coating on your car, the pigments of your makeup, the ingredients of your favorite snacks, the super comfy soles of your sneakers, and much more. 

At BASF we empower our employees with the tools, guidance and opportunities they need to advance and succeed in work and life. Giving you the support you need to be your best and fulfill your personal ambitions is what helps us create chemistry. After all, our success is linked to yours. Whatever path you envision, BASF is a great place to build a rewarding, successful career.
description:
Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You
  
  
  
    At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.
   
    We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.
   
    At BASF, we constantly strive to become an even better workplace. As a result of our commitment to our employees, BASF has earned various awards, including being recognized by Mediacorp as a Top Employer in Canada and the GTA in 2023, and for many consecutive years prior. We are also thrilled that, for the first time ever in 2023, we have been further recognized by Mediacorp as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Diversity, as well as for Young People.
   
    We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
   
    Canola Breeding Summer Associate - Internship (91321)
    Contract Duration: 4 – 8 months (Summer)
    Location: Swift Current
    Wage: $22hr - $29hr
  
 
 
  
    Formula for Success: You Will…
  
  
  
    
   
     Field trials for local and global breeding programs with the goal of developing hybrids that provide the highest return to growers.
     You will be responsible for field activities relating to variety development and registration from seeding to harvest including seed set up, land preparation, seeding, pest control, pollination management, plot maintenance, parental development, harvesting and supervision of casual employees as required.
     You will also be involved in crop health diagnosis through daily monitoring of field and research plots and data collection for Parental and Hybrid Selection
   
  
 
 
  
    Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…
  
  
  
    
   
     Strong agronomic competence attained through pursuing or having obtained your degree in Agriculture or another college. Experience in the Agriculture Industry would be valuable but not required.
     Demonstrate problem solving skills.
     Ability to be flexible and modify plans as situations arise minimizing impact on results.
     Interest in Canola development and Breeding, Hybrid production as well as conducting Field Research Trials.
     Passion for Agriculture and are looking to gain hands on experience working with Canola within a Global business.
     Ability to deliver results in pursuit of both individual and team goals.
     Previous farm or machinery experience an asset but not required.
   
   
    If you need any further assistance, please email Talent Acquisition at: agcampusrelations@basf.com
  
 
 
 
  
    Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
  
  
  
    BASF is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can be their authentic selves. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, place of origin, ethnic origin, colour, religion/creed, sex/pregnancy, marital status, family status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   
    We seek to make our recruitment process accessible for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process, please contact ta-canada@basf.com with the subject line “Recruitment Accommodation Request”.
  
 
 
  
    Privacy Statement
  
  
  
    BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request personal or financial information of any kind via either text message or direct message on any social media platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never offer a candidate a position and request a cheque for equipment or any other type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.
   
    #APJobs

Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You


At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation.


We provide a fulfilling work environment with a strong emphasis on the physical and psychological safety of our employees and the communities we operate in. We are always working to form the best team with an emphasis on diversity, equity and inclusion and through lifelong learning and development.


At BASF, we constantly strive to become an even better workplace. As a result of our commitment to our employees, BASF has earned various awards, including being recognized by Mediacorp as a Top Employer in Canada and the GTA in 2023, and for many consecutive years prior. We are also thrilled that, for the first time ever in 2023, we have been further recognized by Mediacorp as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Diversity, as well as for Young People.


We invite you to join our best team on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!


Canola Breeding Summer Associate - Internship (91321)

Contract Duration: 4 – 8 months (Summer)

Location: Swift Current

Wage: $22hr - $29hr

Formula for Success: You Will…


  • Field trials for local and global breeding programs with the goal of developing hybrids that provide the highest return to growers.
  • You will be responsible for field activities relating to variety development and registration from seeding to harvest including seed set up, land preparation, seeding, pest control, pollination management, plot maintenance, parental development, harvesting and supervision of casual employees as required.
  • You will also be involved in crop health diagnosis through daily monitoring of field and research plots and data collection for Parental and Hybrid Selection

Ingredients for Success: What We Look for in You…


  • Strong agronomic competence attained through pursuing or having obtained your degree in Agriculture or another college. Experience in the Agriculture Industry would be valuable but not required.
  • Demonstrate problem solving skills.
  • Ability to be flexible and modify plans as situations arise minimizing impact on results.
  • Interest in Canola development and Breeding, Hybrid production as well as conducting Field Research Trials.
  • Passion for Agriculture and are looking to gain hands on experience working with Canola within a Global business.
  • Ability to deliver results in pursuit of both individual and team goals.
  • Previous farm or machinery experience an asset but not required.


If you need any further assistance, please email Talent Acquisition at: agcampusrelations@basf.com


Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment


BASF is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where our employees can be their authentic selves. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, place of origin, ethnic origin, colour, religion/creed, sex/pregnancy, marital status, family status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.


We seek to make our recruitment process accessible for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process, please contact ta-canada@basf.com with the subject line “Recruitment Accommodation Request”.

Privacy Statement


BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request personal or financial information of any kind via either text message or direct message on any social media platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never offer a candidate a position and request a cheque for equipment or any other type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.

companyInfo/companyDescription: DECO Windshield Repair has been operating since 2005 and is Canada's largest mobile on-demand windshield service company. With its bright orange kiosks and fun branding, DECO has become a household name for windshield repair, crack repair, and windshield Glass Treatment application across Canada.
description:
$16.00/hr + Commission + Tips
Average First Year Operator Wage: $24.00/hr
Are you a top performer? Do you love to work independently? Do you have what it takes to become a team member at DECO Windshield Repair?
DECO operates seasonally from March to November and is Canada's largest mobile on-demand windshield service company. With its bright orange kiosks and fun branding, DECO has become a household name across Canada for windshield repair and our repair plans.
We are now hiring full-time/part-time Site Operators across Canada and specifically in Lloydminster for our 2024 Season!
Summary:
As a Site Operator with DECO you'll be communicating with customers, repairing windshield damage, selling repair plans, and servicing our existing repair plan customers; all while providing the customer an unforgettable experience. The best part? You'll be outside all day independently running your own kiosk while still being part of a team.
With support from an experienced manager in a fun company culture that likes to work hard and play hard, you are in for the best season of your life!
Requirements:
- Must have excellent people and verbal skills and be willing to engage with customers
- Sales experience is preferred
- Must be driven, motivated, and independent
- Be able to stand for long periods of time
- Access to a vehicle is a requirement
Although sales experience is preferred, no previous experience is necessary to work at DECO since we provide extensive training both on-site and off-site. We pay a base wage and a competitive commission structure based on your individual sales, each day.
At DECO Windshield Repair we pay our employee's top of market; however - you have to earn it.
No handouts here. If you're looking for a job where you can work independently and be responsible for you own wage and earnings, we invite you to apply. Top performers only!
Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to experience and performance. The range listed is just one component of DECO's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, tips, trips (Calgary Stampede + Mexico Trip) and many region-specific benefits and events.Salary Range Transparency$16.00 - 24.00+ per hour
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship / Co-op
Salary: $16.00-$24.00 per hour
Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday
 Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay
 Commission pay
 Retention bonus
 Tips

Work Location: In person

description:
Position PART TIME FOOD STORE CLERK I 
 Department CORONACH FOOD STORE 
 Location CORONACH FOOD STORE 
 Responsibilities 
 1. Provide customer service to customers, by assisting customers, and providing information and product knowledge, which is maintained through being dependable for all shifts. 
 2. Provide packaging of customer purchases, and carry out service of purchases in an efficient, professional manner, and operation of Point of Sale System when necessary. 
 3. To stock food merchandise as per Southland Co-op policies and procedures. 
 4. To perform housekeeping duties, including but not limited to cleaning and facing shelves. 
 5. To ensure proper meat preparation is achieved and maintained, such as traying, wrapping and pricing to meat department standards. 
 6. To ensure that the fresh case, frozen case, smoked case and all spot island merchandisers are filled and merchandised to meat department standards. 
 7. To assist in the preparation of in-store made products such as sausage and hamburger. 
 8. To perform receiving, counting and sorting of merchandise duties as directed. 
 9. To operate and maintain equipment in a safe and responsible manner. 
 10. To adhere to all Southland Co-op policies and procedures related to the maintenance, sanitation and safety of all association assets. 
 11. To assist in preparation of in-store made bakery products. 
 Requirements 
 1. Experience in procurement of merchandise. 
 2. Positive attitude, strong interpersonal skills, outgoing and energetic personality. 
 3. Excellent customer service skills. 
 4. Ability to solve problems. 
 5. Physically able to do heavy lifting, climbing, kneeling. 
 7. Ability to work a variety of shifts, including evenings and weekends. 
 7. Willingness to further knowledge through training. 
 Reports to Food Store Manager

As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs. 
 
  Reporting to the Grocery Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Demonstrate the day-to-day behaviors and actions that align with and strengthen Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, brand and focus on safety 
   Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience 
   Set up and break down and clean up demonstration areas in store 
   Prepare food and distribute samples to guests to generate purchases 
   Distribute coupons, brochures, and other informational or promotional materials to generate interest and inspire purchases 
   Generate brand awareness and positive product impressions in increase sales 
   Always follow proper food safe guidelines 
   Other duties as assigned 
  
 
 Why it Matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 53,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $650 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in Retail Store Operations and Customer Service: 
   
  
   You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
   You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
   You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
   You have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
   You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays 
  
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

positionName: Lake Country Co-op - Part Time Product Demonstrator

description:
Position CLERK I (Student/Casual) 
 Department MOSSBANK HOME & AGRO CENTRE 
 Location Mossbank 
 
 Responsibilities 
 1. Provide customer service to customers, by assisting customers, and providing information and product knowledge, which is maintained through being dependable for all scheduled shifts. 
 2. To perform interior/exterior housekeeping duties. 
 3. Assist in displaying of product as set by the guidelines of Branch Manager. 
 4. To perform opening and closing procedures as directed by manager. 
 6. Dispense gasolines, diesel fuel and propane. 
 7. To clean, fill and maintain all machines, example: coffee, etc. 
 8. Responsible for providing a neat, clean and well merchandised front end at all times. 
 9. Operate point of sale terminal. 
 10. To operate and maintain equipment in a safe and responsible manner. 
 11. To be responsible in the area of loss prevention. 
 12. To assist in daily environmental checks. 
 13. To be familiar with and adhere to Southland Co-op policies and procedures. 
 Requirements 
 
  
   Able to work a variety of shifts. 
  
  
   Strong computer skills. 
  
  
   A pleasant and out-going personality. 
  
  
   A desire and ability to work with the public. 
  
  
   Physically able to do heavy lifting. 
  
  
   Able to work outdoors. 
  
  
   Successfully pass pre-employment testing as per Southland’s Alcohol & Substance Policy 
  
 
 Reports to Branch Manager

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Part Time Student Clerk/Cashier/Pump Attendant at our C-Store and Gas Bar location in Choiceland, SK . 
 Who we are:  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back, and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs. 
 
  Reporting to the Choiceland Corner Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members’ lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
   Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience - in person, on the telephone, at the pumps, and at the point of sale 
   Receive, price, and display merchandise as required for assigned areas 
   Operate the point of sale system with care and accuracy 
   Clean, fill and maintain all machines, example: Coffee, Pop, Slush; perform general housekeeping duties 
   Perform all necessary daily checklists, reconciliations, and reports 
   To be familiar with and adhere to all Lake Country Co-op policies and procedures and be responsible in the areas of safety and asset protection 
   Perform other duties as assigned 
  
 
 Why it Matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 53,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do, and annual sales of over $650 million, we help to build, fuel, feed, and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in Retail Store Operations and Customer Service: 
   
  
   You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and are proud of the work that you do

description:
Position CASHIER (Part Time) 
 Department GROCERY 
 Location Assiniboia 
 Responsibilities 
 1. Provide customer service to customers, by assisting customers, and providing information and product knowledge, which is maintained through being dependable for all scheduled shifts and handling of customer complaints and provide warranty service in a professional manner, as per Southland Co-op policies and procedures. 
 2. To process phone order delivery requests in an orderly manner. 
 3. Process customer transactions on the point of sales system. 
 4. Provide packaging of customer purchases at the checkout counter, when necessary to ensure efficient service for the customer. 
 5. To provide a neat, clean and well merchandised front-end at all times. 
 6. To be familiar with and adhere to Southland Co-op policies and procedures. 
 7. To assist in general stock duties, including filling shelves when not running the point of sale system. 
 8. To achieve and maintain a checkout speed of 35 items per minute. 
 9. To achieve accurate cash balances and proper handling of cheque cashing and credit card procedures. 
 10. Adhere to company loss prevention, security, and safety policies and procedures. 
 Requirements 
 
  
   Positive attitude, strong interpersonal skills, outgoing and energetic personality. 
  
  
   Excellent customer service skills. 
  
  
   Able to work a variety of shifts. 
  
  
   Ability to solve problems. 
  
  
   Willingness to further knowledge through training. 
  
  
   Physically able to do heavy lifting. 
  
  
   Strong computer skills. 
  
  
   A desire and ability to work with the public. 
  
 
 Reports to : Head Cashier

positionName: Part Time Cashier I - Southland Co-op @ Assiniboia Food Store

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full Time Assistant Building Materials Team Leader of at our Home Centre location in Nipawin, SK. 
 If you are looking to use your industry knowledge and leadership skills to take the Home Centre to the next level, the Lake Country Co-op is looking for you! You will be responsible for assisting with day-to-day operations of the entire department. 
 What you’ll do: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Perform administrative and follow up duties such as maintaining customer accounts, ensuring quotes, invoices, and payments are processed and completed accurately to customer satisfaction. 
  Managing and monitoring the store’s inventory, including restocking shelves, ordering new products, and ensuring that popular items are always in stock 
  Assisting in achieving sales goals and targets by recommending products, offering promotions, and upselling when appropriate 
  Assist in overseeing and supervising the sales associates and other staff members, including training and scheduling 
  Ensure that the store is well-organized and visually appealing, with products displayed neatly and in an attractive manner 
  Estimate and provide quotes for building projects 
  Perform receiving of merchandise, stocking shelves, operating point of sale systems, pricing, displays, selling, conducting inventory counts and inventory control procedures related to complaints and warranty 
  Assist with the day-to-day operations, including opening and closing the store, handling the cash registers, and maintaining a safe and clean store environment 
  Other duties as assigned 
 
 Who you’ll work with : Reporting to the Nipawin Home Centre Team Leader you will be a key participant in initiating, developing, and executing plans and policies to ensure continued growth in sales, service, and customer satisfaction. You will assist in leading a department on this fun and passionate team to cultivate a culture of collaboration 
 The Community: Lake Country Co-op is located in a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts. The area offers excellent opportunities for fishing, hunting, boating, and other recreational activities. Nipawin is located in the Carrot River Valley alongside the Nipawin and Saskatchewan Rivers it is known for its natural beauty, with picturesque landscapes, forests, and waterways that attract visitors that appreciate the outdoors. Nipawin hosts various community events throughout the year, including music festivals, fairs, and local gatherings that showcase the area’s heritage and traditions. 
 Why it Matters: Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $650 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Home & Building Products and: 
 
  You have a grade12 and 3 years’ experience in building materials sales; customer service experience especially in the CRS considered an asset 
  You are able to work unsupervised, plan and organize your own work and the work of others 
  You are honest and trustworthy, are results oriented and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
  You have extensive knowledge of building materials industry; estimating and construction experience, trends and codes 
  You have strong computer and technical background, including effective working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 
  You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, are an effective planner, and have superb time management skills 
  You are flexible to work a variety of shifts including a weekend and holiday rotation 
  You are will to travel for short periods of time to attend training events and buying shows 
  Minimum Class 5 Driver’s License is required 
 
 What we offer: 
 
  Competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer matched pension plan 
  Encouragement to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation 
  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a Co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back, investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 
 If you share our commitment to our communities combined with a fresh, innovative vision for our future, please apply online or send your resume to Rebecca Craig, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca by December 2nd, 2023. 
 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to ensure an enjoyable candidate experience. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we invite you to submit your requests to us at recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca . All information received will be kept confidential. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

HABS # 177
positionName: Lake Country Co-op - Assistant Team Leader Building Materials - Nipawin

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full TimeConstruction & Installations Carpenter/Labourer (2 positions) at our Homes by Lake Country location in Prince Albert, SK. We are looking for energetic and motivated Carpenters, 1st, 2nd, 3rd year or equivalent, with experience in construction carpentry and experience on a construction site to work under Red Seal Journeyperson Carpenters. 
 Who we are: Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and membersto enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back,and investing in sustainable growth.To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs . 
 Reporting to the Construction Team Leader, responsibilities for this positioninclude the following: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values,and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Deliver outstanding guest service at all points of contact and through various communication channels 
  Assist skilled trades persons in performing construction activities at residential, commercial, and agricultural construction sites 
  Load and unload materials, move materials to work areas 
  Assist with erecting and dismantling of forms, scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, and barricades 
  Operate and maintain various power tools; tend or feed machines or equipment used in construction such as mixers, compressors, and pumps 
  Remove rubble and other debris at job sites using rakes, shovels, wheelbarrows, and other equipment 
  Follow company policies and procedures related to safety and asset protection 
  Perform otherduties at construction sites, as directed 
 
 Why it matters: Our Lake Country Co-opteam provides a range of products and services to support our over 54,000 member owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do, and annual sales of over $650 million, we help to build, fuel, feed, and grow our communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Home & Building Construction and Customer Service: 
 
  You have knowledge of job site safety rules and regulations (Occupational Health & Safety) 
  You have an eye for quality control/assurance and safety from start to finish 
  You are able to read and interpret blueprints and have knowledge of building codes and regulations 
  You must be physically fit, willing to learn, and are driven to excel in your position 
  You must have a valid Class 5 driver’s license 
  You are willing to obtain the required safety tickets; valid First Aid, Fall Protection, Aerial Lift, and Telehandler certification is an asset 
  A carpentry certificate or any of the levels of carpentry technical/apprenticeship process or provincial Journeyperson status is an asset 
  You’re well organized and able to work independently and with supervision 
  You’re honestand trustworthy, are results-orientated, attentive to detail and striveto be the best in what you do 
  You can lift, load, carry and hold products – extensive physical labour typical of residential and commercial construction site is required 
  You have knowledge of methods, tools and equipment used in carpentry 
  You have a flexiblework schedule including weekends 
  You are available for intermittent day travel and intermittent overnight travel 
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefitspackage, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our TeamMembers to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. Support for post-secondary carpentry education may be provided for suitable applicants. 
 At Lake Country Co-op,we embrace diversityand inclusion, and we are working to createa workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca | Phone:306-953-2061 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

  • A carpentry certificate or any of the levels of carpentry technical/apprenticeship process or provincial Journeyperson status is an asset
  • You’re well organized and able to work independently and with supervision
  • You’re honestand trustworthy, are results-orientated, attentive to detail and striveto be the best in what you do
  • You can lift, load, carry and hold products – extensive physical labour typical of residential and commercial construction site is required
  • You have knowledge of methods, tools and equipment used in carpentry
  • You have a flexiblework schedule including weekends
  • You are available for intermittent day travel and intermittent overnight travel

Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefitspackage, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our TeamMembers to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. Support for post-secondary carpentry education may be provided for suitable applicants.

At Lake Country Co-op,we embrace diversityand inclusion, and we are working to createa workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca | Phone:306-953-2061

We thank all candidates for their interest; only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Established and growing Canadian trucking company. Our vision is to operate a disciplined company is transport sector. As we grow, we always focus on providing adequate and honest service to our customers. We will continue to provide our customers with confidence in our services. All of our company staff respects and treats everyone with integrity and respect. 
Denali transport runs with equipment under 2 years old on average to diminish the down time on the road so that our drivers are safe and confident and we keep our promise to customers for delivering the goods on time.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the positions of Full Time Driver – Professional Services at our Home Centre location in Prince Albert, Sk. 
 Who we are: Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 Reporting to the Prince Albert Home Centre Team Leader, Responsibilities for this position include the following: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Provide outstanding guest service; load and unload merchandise and maintain cleanliness and order of merchandise in the yard 
  Fill orders, receive freight, deliver, and unload product, preform inventory counts 
  Build positive relationships with the yard, desk, and leadership teams 
  Perform customer carry out service and product assembly as assigned 
  Complete required paperwork base on department standards 
  Follow company policies and procedures 
  Perform other duties as assigned in all areas of the Home Centre 
 
 Why it matters: Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $650 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Home & Building Products and Customer Service: 
 
  You have a grade 12 or equivalent experience; customer service experience is an asset 
  You’re well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
  You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-orientated, and strive to be the best in what you do 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
  You have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
  Must have a valid Class 1A or 3A driver’s license, must be willing to obtain forklift certification 
  You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, and holidays 
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca | Phone: 306-953-2061 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Part Time Clerk/Cashier at our C-Store/Gas Bar location in Big River, SK. 
 Who we are: Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 Reporting to the C-Store Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Provide Legendary in-store service; serve guests, operate the point-of-sale system, stock shelves, face shelves, and perform general housekeeping duties 
  Ensure safety is held as the highest priority 
  Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience 
  Maintain a neat, clean and orderly location at all times 
  Have a good working understanding of the point-of-sale system 
  Order, receive, price and display merchandise as required as specified by the team leader 
  Complete the necessary daily reconciliations and reports 
  Follow company policies and procedures and perform other duties as assigned 
 
 Why it matters: Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $675 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Retail Store Operations and Customer Service: 
 
  You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
  You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
  You’re attentive to detail and have strong cash management skills 
  You have an ability to fulfill physical job requirements – standing, working inside and outside, lifting 20 to 25 pounds regularly 
  You have POS experience and have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
  You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays 
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full Time Bakery Team Leader of at our Food Store location in Prince Albert, SK. 
 If you are looking to use your industry knowledge and leadership skills to take the Bakery Department to the next level, the Lake Country Co-op is looking for you! You will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of the entire department. 
 What you’ll do: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Managing and monitoring the store’s inventory, including restocking shelves, ordering new products, and ensuring that popular items are always in stock 
  Oversee and supervise the bakery department staff members, including training and scheduling 
  Ensure that the bakery department is well-organized and visually appealing, with products displayed neatly and in an attractive manner 
  Perform receiving of merchandise, stocking shelves, pricing, displays, selling, conducting inventory counts 
  Ensure maintenance on all equipment is completed to schedule; follow all Food Safe and Health and Safety regulations and practices 
  Other duties as assigned 
 
 Who you’ll work with : Reporting to the Director, Food, you will be a key participant in initiating, developing, and executing plans and policies to ensure continued growth in sales, service, and customer satisfaction. You will lead a department on this fun and passionate team to cultivate a culture of collaboration. 
 The Community: Lake Country Co-op is in one of the best areas for hunting, fishing and outdoor experiences in Western Canada. It is a short drive to Prince Albert National Park that has over 1,500 lakes to visit and countless activities and events to choose from! The city of Prince Albert has several parks and recreational activities as well from Little Red River Park, to the Mann Art Gallery, Alfred Jenkins Field house. There are fun-filled activities for the entire family. No Matter the season, there is endless adventure possibilities within an hour’s drive, making Prince Albert like no other place in Canada. 
 Why it Matters: Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $675 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Retail Store Operations and: 
 
  You have a grade 12 or combination of relevant experience; experience decorating cakes is preferred 
  You have a minimum of 2 – 3 years of retail experience; CRS and Bakery experience is an asset 
  You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
  You must be able to plan and organize your own work and that of others, supervise others, and delegate to others 
  You’re honest and trustworthy, are results-oriented, and strive to be the best in what you do 
  You are familiar with Food Safe procedures and practices 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives 
  You have the ability to fulfill physical job requirements – standing, and perform heavy lifting regularly; extensive manual labour is required 
  You have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
  You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings, and holidays 
 
 What we offer: 
 
  Competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer matched pension plan 
  Encouragement to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation 
  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a Co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back, investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 
 If you share our commitment to our communities combined with a fresh, innovative vision for our future, please apply online or send your resume to Rebecca Craig, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca 
 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to ensure an enjoyable candidate experience. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we invite you to submit your requests to us at recruiting@lakecountrycoop.ca . All information received will be kept confidential. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That’s why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind. 

We care about the communities we serve—because they’re our communities too. This allows us to assess what’s needed and connect our expertise, to appreciate nuances and envision what’s never been considered, to bring together diverse perspectives so we can collaborate toward a shared success.  

We’re designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe. 

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. Visit us at Stantec.com/careers
description:
Environmental Services Student / Intern - Summer 2024 (4 months) - ( 230004SJ ) 
 Description 
 Grounded in safety, quality, and ethics, our experts lead their fields and guide our work with rigour, a creative spirit, and vision for growth. We draw from more than 20 technical specialties around the globe and are committed to fostering an inclusive community of diverse talents, backgrounds, and expertise. We’re a place to apply your passion and collaborate with top environmental talents on work that’s critical to our clients and the communities they support. Join a team that has the environment down to a science. 
 Your Opportunity 
 Stantec's Prairies Environmental Services Team in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan currently has Summer Student opportunities for the upcoming field season. As a summer student, your role would include but not necessarily be limited to: field and office work with our Site Assessment, Remediation and Response Team; Assessment and Permitting Team; and/or Ecosystems Team. 
 Your Key Responsibilities 
 
  Assisting technical staff with various project tasks including researching, compiling and evaluating project data, and preparing technical reports. 
  Field work including environmental site assessments; construction monitoring support; soil sampling, groundwater monitoring and sampling; and aquatics and terrestrial monitoring support. 
  Participating in proposal and/or report preparations, may perform calculations; gather, review or report information; and/or prepare standard document sections. 
  Complete other administrative duties, as required. 
  Available to travel within and potentially outside Saskatchewan; working in a wide range of climatic conditions. 
 
 Qualifications 
 Your Capabilities and Credentials 
 
  Valid Manitoba Driver’s License and clean driver’s abstract. 
  Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). 
  Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. 
  Strong work ethic and ability to multi-task, prioritize, and take direction. 
  Basic understanding of waste management concepts and environmental legislation. 
  Basic understanding of terrestrial and aquatic ecosystem interactions and their components. 
  A successful drug/alcohol screening may be required. 
 
 Education and Experience 
 In progress toward earning or have completed a Bachelor’s degree or technical diploma in an Environmental related field. 
 Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather. 
 This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice. 
 Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. 
 Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off. 
 Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account. 
 The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements. 
 Primary Location : Canada-Saskatchewan-Saskatoon 
 Organization : BC-1114 EnvSvcs-CA Prairies & Territories 
 Employee Status : Temporary 
 Job Level : Entry Level 
 Travel : Yes, 75 % of the Time 
 Schedule : Full-time 
 Job Posting : Nov 23, 2023, 1:09:35 PM 
 Req ID: 230004SJ 
 Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Stantec is in compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment. EEO including Disability/Protected Veterans

  • Available to travel within and potentially outside Saskatchewan; working in a wide range of climatic conditions.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials

  • Valid Manitoba Driver’s License and clean driver’s abstract.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to multi-task, prioritize, and take direction.
  • Basic understanding of waste management concepts and environmental legislation.
  • Basic understanding of terrestrial and aquatic ecosystem interactions and their components.
  • A successful drug/alcohol screening may be required.

Education and Experience

In progress toward earning or have completed a Bachelor’s degree or technical diploma in an Environmental related field.

Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.

Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.

The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

Primary Location : Canada-Saskatchewan-Saskatoon

Organization : BC-1114 EnvSvcs-CA Prairies & Territories

Employee Status : Temporary

Job Level : Entry Level

Travel : Yes, 75 % of the Time

Schedule : Full-time

Job Posting : Nov 23, 2023, 1:09:35 PM

Req ID: 230004SJ

Stantec provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for future and current employment and prohibit discrimination on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Full Time Territory Agro Salesperson at our Agro location in Shellbrook, SK. 
 Who we are: Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs 
 Reporting to the Agro Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
 
  Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
  Engage and interact with guests to create a positive experience – in person, on the telephone and at the point of sale 
  On the road sales and after sales service of our complete line of Ag equipment products and service to our members and agriculture customers 
  Farm planning, database and customer contact management 
  Environmental compliance 
  Other duties as assigned 
 
 Why it Matters: Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $675 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together. 
 Who you are: 
 You are looking for a career in Agriculture and Customer Service: 
 
  You have Ag equipment experience and/or Pag designations, background in agriculture would be considered assets 
  You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production, with a minimum amount of supervision 
  You are honest and trustworthy, are results-oriented, and strive to be the best in what you do 
  You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives 
  You have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
  You have a flexible work schedule understanding the seasonal peaks of the commodity 
  You have a class 5 license as you will travel throughout the region 
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 rebecca.collins@lakecountrycoop.ca | Phone: 306-953-2061 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

 Who we are: Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy in our communities, delivering profits back and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs

  Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience- in person, on the telephone and at the point of sale 
  Demonstrate a complete understanding of menu items and explain accurately to guests 
  Prepare food neatly, according to formula, and in a timely manner; pack food for takeout/drive through guests 
  Understand and adhere to proper food handling, safety and sanitation standards during food preparation, service and clean up 
  Check and monitor product in food preparation area and restock items to ensure a sufficient supply throughout shift 
  Use Point of Sale system to record orders, compute the amount of bill and make change

  Perform light paperwork duties as assigned

 Why it Matters: Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 54,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do and annual sales of over $650 million we help to build, fuel, feed and grow our communities together.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Bunge is a world leader agribusiness and food company. Everyone, everywhere needs food to lead healthy and productive lives. The global agri-food supply chain sustains families, societies, economies and nations, and that chain depends on us. We connect farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed and fuel to the world in a safe and sustainable way. Our almost 25,000 employees, located in more than 40 countries, stand behand 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging plants around the world.

We have more than two centuries of experience, unmatched global scale and deeply rooted relationships everywhere we operate, helping improve the communities where we live. We source oilseeds and grains, manage a global logistics network to transport them worldwide, we create value-added food and ingredients for customers and consumers and we provide know-how to some of the world’s biggest brands. Learn more about how you can grow your career at Bunge.

#ProudToBeBunge
description:
Essential Functions:
   
  
   Participate in the day-to-day operation at assigned Bunge location, promoting and abiding by Bunge’s zero incident and injury safety culture
   Communicate effectively with Bunge internal and external customers
   Gain fundamental knowledge of domestic and international cash grain and grain product marketing, trading, and flows
   Develop a thorough understanding of elevator, milling and oilseed processing plant operations
   Aid in evaluating changing crop and market conditions
   Work effectively in a team setting to collaborate, develop strategy and problem-solve
   Assist in managing customer relationships, contracts, logistics, data analytics, and other related activities
   Complete special project requests, as assigned
   Demonstrate level of comprehension by responding to verbal or written inquiries from supervisors, mentors, or other team members
   Travel to other Bunge locations and/or events for instructional purposes
   
   Skills/Experience Requirements:
   
  
   Pursuing bachelor’s degree from a four-year accredited college or university
   Must be collaborative, results oriented and possess strong critical thinking skills
   Ability to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, adversity, and constant change
   Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
   Analytical problem-solving skills
   Proficiency in standard PC applications
   Standard work hours 8 AM - 5 PM subject to adjustment as required by assignment
  
 
  Location to be determined.
  Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.
 
  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

companyInfo/companyDescription: Allnorth is a multidisciplinary engineering and technical services consulting company servicing clients in the Mining, Oil & Gas, Infrastructure and Pulp & Paper sectors. With offices across Canada and the USA, Allnorth has an entrepreneurial spirit that allows us to be responsive to our clients. Allnorth’s motivated team delivers innovative, practical solutions that fulfill project needs and fit within the reality of our client’s budgets. Our business model of local offices allows us to deliver the best service in our industry and foster successful client relationships.
description:
Civil Engineering Student (4 or 8 month terms) 
   Saskatoon, SK 
   About Allnorth 
   BIG ENOUGH TO KNOW HOW, SMALL ENOUGH TO KNOW YOU 
   Allnorth is a multi-disciplinary engineering, project delivery, and construction services company. We provide smart and practical project solutions to clients in the metals and minerals, energy and renewables, fiber and chemicals, and infrastructure sectors. With offices across Canada, and into the US and Mexico, we continue to grow! 
   Our team is our most valuable asset, and a triple bottom line (TBL) philosophy is at the heart of our business. It takes a talented, motivated and empowered team to delight our clients, driving profitability for all parties. When it comes to guiding principles, safety is part of our DNA, we are committed to building and nurturing Indigenous relationships, we support our communities, and we recognize the importance of environmental stewardship.
   
   
   Our Ideal Candidate 
   We are currently seeking several 4-8 month co op students, starting anywhere from May to September to support a variety of projects for our teams in Saskatoon, SK. Your duties may include, but are not limited to: 
   
   Survey assistant work 
   Laboratory concrete and aggregate testing 
   Onsite concrete and aggregate testing 
   Civil/Structural design, analysis, reporting, proposal preparation, field inspections 
   
  Perks of working in Saskatoon: 
   
   Gaining valuable experience both regionally and technically 
   Work alongside a young and dynamic team 
   Enjoy the outdoor adventures surrounding these geographic location
  
   
   
   What You’ll Bring to the Team 
   
   Currently enrolled in a Civil or Environmental Engineering or Engineering Technology program 
   Available for a minimum of 4 months in 2024 
   Strong willingness to learn and contribute to a team environment 
   A love for the outdoors – this position involves fieldwork 
   Valid, clean Class 5 Driver’s License 
   Ability to pass a pre-employment Drug & Alcohol test 
   Excellent communication 
   Previous relevant experience would be considered an asset, but is not required
  
   
   
   What’s in it for you? 
   We believe that a happy and fulfilled team leads to exceptional results, which is why we offer a range of perks designed to support your well-being, career growth and community engagement. 
   
    Work schedule and location are flexible, allowing for better work-life balance 
   A culture of respect and inclusivity fosters long term relationships and a team atmosphere 
   Professional development and growth opportunities (e.g. New and Young Worker Mentorship program) 
   Team Member Referral Program 
    A paid “Volunteer Day” away from work to support the community 
   Monthly “Lunch & Learn” sessions 
   Opportunities to bond with other team members, have fun and make a difference through involvement in social and safety committees, as well as fundraising and community support initiatives (e.g. Movember, Pi Day, Food Banks, Women’s Shelters, Ronald McDonald House, Earth Day clean ups, etc.). 
   Competitive hourly of $24-$28 / hour dependent on experience, skills, and qualifications
  
   
   
   WE TAKE CARE OF YOU SO YOU CAN TAKE CARE OF OUR CLIENTS 
   In joining us you’ll face rewarding, career-developing challenges that enable you to contribute to our clients’ successes, and despite how much we grow, you’ll never be just a number, but rather a vital member of the Allnorth Team. 
  Engage with us at Allnorth and be empowered to enrich people’s lives, including your own. 
  Allnorth is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, status as a qualified individual with disability, or any other legally protected status. All applicants must be able to show proof of eligibility to work in Canada. 
  We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
In Canada, Veolia helps customers address environmental and sustainability challenges in energy, water and waste.
 
We know our planet’s natural resources are limited and demands are increasing.
Our mission is to resource the world — helping preserve, replenish and develop access to what's available.

Our commitment to resourcing the world means:

• Considering waste as a primary ressource and something to value.
• Treating water to make it drinkable or usable.
• Harnessing heat generated by production as a form of sustainable energy.

For more information about Veolia North America, visit our veolianorthamerica.com.

Nouvelle récente: 
There are record levels of plastic debris floating the Arctic Ocean — far from human civilization. Check out how the Tara Expeditions Foundation is working to analyze the effect of plastic waste on our oceans.

Specializations
Industrial Cleaning & Maintenance, Hazardous & Regulated Waste Management, Water Partnership Services, Wastewater Partnership Services, Design, Build, Operate & Maintain et Energy Efficient Solutions

Approx 8000 employees in North America and 1700 in Canada
description:
Position Title: Chemical Treatment Intern 
 Locaition: Saskatchewan 
 Duration: 12-16 month commitment
  
  
 About Us:
  
  
 Join the Resource Revolution! Veolia Water Technologies & Solutions looks for innovation everywhere. For more than 100 years, Veolia has been at the forefront of innovation. Finding solutions to the world's biggest problems has never been more important than right now. Join us today and become an essential part of the Resource Revolution! 
 Veolia’s Water Technologies and Solutions (VWTS) offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. VWTS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
  
  
 The Position: 
 As the Field Service Representative Intern, you will be joining a strong technical service environment. In this role, you will have an opportunity to work alongside experienced professionals within the field of industrial water treatment. You will gain exposure supporting water treatment and assist the organization in achieving its annual goals and objectives as an active participant.
  
  
 Nature of work: 
 Your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to); 
 
  Generate system drawings, PFDs, for use in on-site manuals and proposals 
  Conduct wet testing in laboratory on water samples 
  Actively monitor process equipment performance through online tools 
  Assist in completing monthly reporting requirements 
  Manage bulk chemical inventory and assist with ordering chemical products as required 
  Work with supervisors on plant equipment optimization opportunities 
  Perform field checks on process equipment (flows, pH, conductivity, chemical residuals, etc.) 
 
 
 Do you qualify? We are seeking… 
 Skills: 
 
  Experience performing basic chemical tasks such as titrations, pH & conductivity measurements, and using other simple chemistry lab instruments 
  Basic mechanical skills to help troubleshoot chemical feed equipment 
  Computer skills – use of Microsoft Office, Visio, and online data Management 
  Strong teamwork & communication skills 
  Ability to prioritize and maintain deliverables in a fast-paced work environment 
 
 
 Education: 
 
  This role is best suited for anyone currently enrolled in a Bachelor of Engineering (BEng) program (Chemical, Environmental, Industrial, or Mechanical) or a Chemistry Bachelor of Science (BSc) program. Consideration will also be given to other science-based technical programs and degrees. 
 
 
 Please note that this position does not provide a subsidy for relocation expenses. 
 Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in joining VWTS.
