  • Assist in completing monthly reporting requirements

  • Manage bulk chemical inventory and assist with ordering chemical products as required

  • Work with supervisors on plant equipment optimization opportunities

  • Perform field checks on process equipment (flows, pH, conductivity, chemical residuals, etc.)


Do you qualify? We are seeking…

Skills:

  • Experience performing basic chemical tasks such as titrations, pH & conductivity measurements, and using other simple chemistry lab instruments

  • Basic mechanical skills to help troubleshoot chemical feed equipment

  • Computer skills – use of Microsoft Office, Visio, and online data Management

  • Strong teamwork & communication skills

  • Ability to prioritize and maintain deliverables in a fast-paced work environment


Education:

  • This role is best suited for anyone currently enrolled in a Bachelor of Engineering (BEng) program (Chemical, Environmental, Industrial, or Mechanical) or a Chemistry Bachelor of Science (BSc) program. Consideration will also be given to other science-based technical programs and degrees.


Please note that this position does not provide a subsidy for relocation expenses.

Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in joining VWTS.

description:
The Delta Co-op is now accepting applications for a Student Meat Clerk at our Macklin Location. 
  Who we are: 
  Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.deltaco-op.crs 
  What you'll do: 
  Applicants will be required to work stock, face the department, clean and maintain sanitation and safety standards of the department , organize warehouse, wrap meat. Must have good communication skills, and be able to work in a group or on their own. Ensure outstanding courteous guest service is provided at all times. Perform other duties assigned. They should be goal orientated, dependable. The meat room is cold, so must be able to work in a cold environment for long periods of time. They should be able to lift 50LBS and comfortable working with heavy cutting machinery. 
  Who you are: 
  You are looking for a career in Customer Service, available to work weekdays, evenings and weekends, are honest, dependable, trustworthy and enthusiastic with a strong customer service focus.
  
  
  Our Team Members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
  At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

  Responsible to provide an exceptional level of customer service and maintain a safe and efficient operation while adhering to all company policies, procedures, and standards, including meeting established productivity standards. Responsible for the general merchandise of the department and the care and safe use of any tools or equipment required. This includes operating, completing general housekeeping duties, assisting team members when necessary, and any other duties as assigned. 
  Performs indoor and outdoor/yard duties to ensure all areas of responsibility are safe, organized, clean, and tidy. Ability to lift fifty pounds. Responsible for keeping the sales floor and back stock area clean of cardboard and debris including the disposal of garbage. Ensure all tools and equipment required to complete assigned duties are well maintained and safe to use. Report any concerns to the team leader for review before use. 
  Why it matters: 
  Our team provides a range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build, fuel, feed and grow Western Canadian communities together.

  Class 5 license is an asset 
  Exceptional Customer Service 
  A friendly, co-operative attitude is brought to the work place daily

  Willing to work evening and weekends 
  You’re familiar with Lumber Industry

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  An exciting co-op opportunity awaits a motivated student at our Loveland, CO or Saskatoon, Canada office beginning May 2024 for an approximate 8-month term. This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position reporting to the Senior Manager, Nitrogen Rail Operations and is open to current students who will be returning to their studies once this work term is complete. This position is not available for remote work
 
  What you will do:
  
 
  Data cleansing and analysis
   Rail car expediting, processing rail diversions and rebills
   Pipeline management and dwell reports
   Invoice review, analysis, and reconciliation 
  Vacation coverage
   Customer demurrage analysis and tracking
   Dwell reports
   Assist in reporting and presentation creation using Power BI and MS PowerPoint
   Support process and continuous improvement initiatives 
  Conduct ad hoc analysis as required
   Project support
 
 
  What you will bring:
  
 
  Currently enrolled in Business, Commerce, or IT (or equivalent degree) undergraduate program at an accredited post-secondary institution AND returning to full-time studies after the work term
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor, and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Crescent Point is a leading North American light oil producer, driven to enhance shareholder returns by cost-effectively developing a focused asset base in a responsible and sustainable manner.
description:
Bringing energy to our world, the right way. It’s our purpose statement that drives us to do the right thing, the right way, every day. We are a passionate team of high performers who challenge the status quo while staying focused on operational excellence and delivering results. Our culture is defined by our people and how we work together, and we are excited that you want to be a part of it.
 
 
   Our energy is also represented by our people, what we bring to the communities we operate in and what we bring to each of our relationships. Here at Crescent Point Energy, we are investing in the talent that will shape the future of not only our organization, but our industry. Our student programs are designed so students can gain valuable experience to help kickstart their career in a respectful and supportive work environment.
 
 
 
   Purpose:
 
 
   Crescent Point Energy is looking to fill Engineering Internship positions for May 2024 based in Swift Current, SK. These internships are 16-months in length and provide you the opportunity to get hands on experience that will develop the skills for a career in Oil and Gas industry.
 
 
 
   Please include a cover letter, resume and a copy of your transcript in one document as part of your application.
 
 
 
   Main Duties & Responsibilities:
 
 
   Interns will work under the guidance of an experienced engineer. You will have the opportunity to work as part of a dynamic high performing team. You will do challenging work, solve problems, and make an impact.
 
 
 
   Facilities Engineering
 
 
  
   
     Assist the Engineering team with the scoping, design, and project management of various gas and oil related facilities projects
   
  
   
     Design, estimate, and execute various gas and oil related facilities projects (oil batteries, pipelines, pump/compressor stations, etc.)
   
  
   
     Assist with the initiation and execution of the Management of Change (MOC) process, including necessary engineering calculations
   
  
   
     Field data capture, including as-built updates to process and instrumentation diagrams (P&ID’s)
   
  
   
     Help support ESG initiatives that involve the Facilities Engineering group
   
  
   
     Monitoring changes to drilling and completions schedule to determine affected project timelines
   
  
   
     Develop an understanding of relevant codes, standards, and regulations and their application
   
  
   
     Project cost tracking, accruals, and assisting with forecasting of project expenditures
   
  
   
     Develop hydraulic models of flowline systems to support effective project scoping and operational troubleshooting
   
 
 
 
   Qualifications:
 
 
  
   
     Enrolled in 3rd year of an undergraduate bachelor’s degree in Engineering and scheduled to return to school following a 16-month internship
   
  
   
     Previous experience in the oil and gas industry would be an asset
   
  
   
     Excellent computer skills with in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel
   
  
   
     Experience with business intelligence software (Power BI, Spotfire) and/or data analysis tools (Python, R) would be an asset
   
  
   
     High level of accuracy and attention to detail is essential
   
  
   
     Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment is required
   
  
   
     Enthusiastic individual with excellent organizational and time management skills\
   
  
   
     Team player who enjoys learning and contributing to team goals
   
 
 
   Why Crescent Point
 
 
   Working at Crescent Point means you are part of a highly engaged workforce who is supported, engaged, and connected. As part of our student programs, you will be mentored and led by our best and brightest people leaders.
 
 
   Crescent Point is committed to building an inclusive organization that harnesses diverse thinking to innovate and grow. We are transforming our talent programming using an inclusive design lens where diverse points of view and talent are supported and encouraged.
 
 
   Crescent Point Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and work environment. If you require accommodations at any stage in the hiring process, please let our Talent Management team know. This includes conducting interviews in person or virtually via Microsoft Teams. If you like the sound of Crescent Point’s culture so far and think you would be a great addition to the team, we encourage you to apply!

companyInfo/companyDescription:
Bunge is a world leader agribusiness and food company. Everyone, everywhere needs food to lead healthy and productive lives. The global agri-food supply chain sustains families, societies, economies and nations, and that chain depends on us. We connect farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed and fuel to the world in a safe and sustainable way. Our almost 25,000 employees, located in more than 40 countries, stand behand 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging plants around the world.

We have more than two centuries of experience, unmatched global scale and deeply rooted relationships everywhere we operate, helping improve the communities where we live. We source oilseeds and grains, manage a global logistics network to transport them worldwide, we create value-added food and ingredients for customers and consumers and we provide know-how to some of the world’s biggest brands. Learn more about how you can grow your career at Bunge.

#ProudToBeBunge
description:
At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program and opportunity to progress. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:
   
  
   Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
   Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
   Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably
  
 
  Position Summary: The Bunge Safety Internship Program is looking for collaborative results-oriented candidates with strong critical thinking and communication skills. The internship is designed to give you an understanding of how safety is driven at a company who prioritizes safety first and has a strong safety culture. During the internship, you will be exposed to various aspects of safety management. You will develop the skills and knowledge needed to provide a solid foundation to build a career in the safety field.
 
  Core Functions: Support Bunge safety culture and improvements by participating in projects or initiatives identified by the site. This could include: Developing training material Updating procedures, safe work instructions, and/or JHAs Conducting for PPE and confined space hazard assessments, reviewing LOTO procedures, and reviewing completed permits Tracking and trending of proactive and reactive metrics Conduct procedural gap analysis Conduct audits and develop reports with corrective actions Ability to travel to other Bunge facilities for development and/or assistance as requested Assist in training development. Develop a thorough understanding of high potential exposures and conduct gap analysis. Demonstrate your level of understanding by responding to verbal or written inquiries from supervisors, mentors, or program manager. Analyze data and develop reports. Travel to other Bunge locations for training and exposure purposes Ability to communicate effectively with Bunge internal and external customers
 
  Skill/Experience Requirements: Pursuing an Occupational Health and Safety Diploma or Certificate. Ability to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, adversity, and constant change Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Analytical problem-solving skills Proficiency in standard PC applications
  Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.
 
  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  Discover more about potash at Nutrien! An exciting co-op opportunity awaits a motivated student at our Vanscory Potash Mine beginning May 2024 for a 16-month term. This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position reporting to the Senior Supervisor, Mine Maintenance Engineering, and is open to current students who will be returning to their studies once this work term is complete. This position is not available for remote work.
 
  What you will do:
  
 
 
   Assist with a variety of electrical engineering tasks
   Support ongoing and new engineering studies, existing asset inspection and condition reporting, drawing updates, and document control
   Design work and project management are potential opportunities depending on the aptitude of the candidate
   Contribute to the safety culture at Vanscoy Potash by demonstrating strict adherence to safety policies and procedures
 
 
  What you will bring:
  
 
 
   Completed a minimum of two years in an Electrical or Mechanical Engineering program or equivalent
   Experience working in a mining or industrial environment is preferred
   Outstanding interpersonal, teamwork and communication skills are essential
   Positive safety behavior and safety guidance
   Ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment as well as independently
   Willingness to learn and gain adequate knowledge and experience through training
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

description:
Summary
 
 
   We are on a growth journey and invest for a long-term sustainability through efforts that ensure a first-class production and products – both for ourselves, our farmers and for future generations. At Väderstad we develop our business by developing people. We want our employees to feel motivated, safe, and proud. That is why we work with an encouraging culture, where everyone can develop their competence and grow with Vaderstad
 
 
 
   The Design Co-op Student is responsible to assist with all facets of R&D projects, including research, CAD design, prototype development and testing. The Design Co-op Student will assist with projects as well as coordinate work with team members and other members of the company. You must be willing to continuously learn new skills and apply them without supervision. Term for position is from 8 -16-month term.
 
 
 
   Education/Experience
 
 
   Must be enrolled in a Mechanical or Industrial Engineering Degree program
   Knowledge of Creo or equivalent CAD systems an asset
   Good knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite
   Knowledge of hydraulics, electronics, and electrical circuits, pneumatic and structural design
   Knowledge of and experience with current farming practices and equipment are an asset
 
 
 
   Core Competencies
 
 
   Mechanically inclined with an understanding of the design process.
   Strong communication and organizational skills
   Adaptable
   Self-Starter
   Must work well individually and as part of a team
   Ability to think critically and analytically
   Fluent in English
 
 
 
   Accountabilities
 
 
   Assist engineers with design and project work as required, following instructions given
   Using the change management process, create and maintain computer models and drawings of equipment components for all product lines
   Complete design analysis and design refinement
   Write and follow through with testing reports
   Communicate with internal departments as well as outside vendors and customers to create design solutions
   Identify areas to improve quality, cost and equipment features
   Follow internal standards and policies
 
 
 
   Work Conditions
 
 
   Primarily a typical office working environment
   Shop exposure is required during the prototyping and testing phases
   Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
   Work is performed in a combination of environments which require the usage of Personal Protective Equipment
   This position may be exposed to elements such as noise, dust, odors, fumes, and oils
   Lifting or moving up to 50lbs may be required
   Overtime as required

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Part Time Student Grocery Clerk (2 positions) at our Food Store location in Nipawin, SK. 
 
  Who we are: 
   Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back, and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs. 
   Reporting to the Grocery Team Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members’ lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
   Engage and interact with guests to create a positive shopping experience 
   Serve guests, operate till, pack groceries, stock and face shelves, retrieve carts, and perform general housekeeping duties 
   Continually monitor code dates to ensure the freshest inventory is always on the shelves; follow First In, First Out 
   Ensure the store is clean, safe and in order 
   Other duties as assigned 
  
 
 Why it Matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our 53,000 member-owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do, and annual sales of over $650 million, we help to build, fuel, feed, and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in Retail Store Operations and Customer Service: 
   
  
   You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
   You are well organized and capable of attaining a high level of production with a minimum amount of supervision 
   You believe in building relationships and collaborating to deliver solutions that matter most, and you recognize the value that different perspectives bring to meet shared objectives. 
   You have the ability to work in a fast paced, guest facing environment 
   You have a flexible work schedule including weekends, evenings, and holidays 
   You have the ability to lift and load products - extensive physical labour is required 
  
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer- contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

description:
Lake Country Co-op invites applications for the position of Part Time Yard Clerk (2 positions) at our Home Centre location in Prince Albert, SK . 
 Who we are:  Lake Country Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to provide an exceptional experience to customers and members to enhance the success and vibrancy of our communities, delivering profits back, and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our Lake Country Co-op brand to life, visit us at www.lakecountryco-op.crs. 
 
  Reporting to the Warehouse & Logistics Leader, responsibilities for this position include the following: 
   
  
   Demonstrate the behaviors and actions to support Lake Country Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, and safety principles to make a difference in members’ lives, with a strong customer focused approach 
   To come to work with a positive, professional attitude and be dependable for all shifts 
   To provide information, assistance, and service to customers in a manner which will promote the sale of merchandise and meet the needs, requirements, and expectations of the consumer 
   Fill orders, receive freight, deliver, and unload product, and perform inventory counts 
   Build positive relationships with the yard crew, desk, and leadership teams 
   To keep aisles, yard, and stockpiles neat and free of obstruction 
   Perform customer carry out service and product assembly as assigned 
   Complete required paperwork based on department standards 
   Follow company policies and procedures 
   Practice and maintain safe procedures for the handling and stocking of merchandise 
   Perform other duties as assigned in all areas of the Home Centre 
  
 
 Why it matters:  Our Lake Country Co-op team provides a range of products and services to support our over 54,000 member owners in 20 different communities. Through the work that we do, and annual sales of over $650 million, we help to build, fuel, feed, and grow our communities together. 
 
  Who you are: 
   You are looking for a career in Home & Building Products and Customer Service and: 
   
  
   You have a grade 12; previous work experience in a Home Centre retail location or building materials industry would be an asset 
   You must possess sufficient knowledge and experience of Lumber and Building Materials to effectively operate in all areas of the location 
   You must be strongly service oriented and motivated, and capable of serving and assisting customers in a courteous and efficient manner 
   You are honest and trustworthy, are results orientated, and strive to be the best in the work that you do 
   You are well organized, capable of attaining a high level of production with a minimum amount of supervision 
   You have a valid Class 5 driver’s license and must be willing to obtain forklift certification 
   Must have a flexible work schedule including weekends and holidays 
   You must have the ability to fulfill physical job requirements including heavy lifting and carrying 
  
 
 Our Lake Country Co-op team members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop, and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
 At Lake Country Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work. 
 We thank all candidates for their interest; only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

description:
The Delta Coop is now accepting applications for Student positions to join our team at our Macklin Dairy Queen location. 
  Who we are: 
  Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. 
  What you’ll do: 
  Demonstrate day to day behaviors and actions that align with and strengthen our Co-operative’s vision, mission, values, brand and focus on safety. 
  Strive to create positive memories for all our fans so we are looking for positive, energetic employees who are passionate about the Dairy Queen brand and delivering exceptional customer service. If you enjoy working in a fun, fast paced environment we would love to hear from you. Applicants should be eager to lead, do things right, be accountable, have ownership in what they do, and be able to create smiles and stories for our fans. 
  Front Counter Crew Member 
  
  Be an ambassador of the Dairy Queen brand and be professional in every aspect of performance 
  Enthusiastically greet and welcome fans to the Dairy Queen brand 
  Assist fans with menu navigation and product ingredient questions 
  Strive to exceed fan expectations and deliver fan first service through timely and quality service 
  Calmly solve fan concerns and embrace Dairy Queen’s service recovery standards 
  Be a willing team player and maintain a cooperative, harmonious working relationship with management and fellow team members 
  Prepare treat products following restaurant, health, and safety standards and procedures 
  Create and maintain a positive, safe, clean, and inviting environment for fans and team members 
  At all times exhibit a genuine passion for excellence 
  Perform other duties as assigned by management 
  Communicate positively with fans and co-workers constantly during shifts 
  Work well under pressure packed situations while maintaining a great attitude 
  Comfortable standing for entire shift and able to lift 50 pounds 
  Practice established food handling procedures and meet any local health regulations 
  Exhibit good manners, proper personal hygiene and promptness 
  Have fun and maintain a positive attitude at all times!
 
  
  
  Kitchen Crew Member
  
 
    Be an ambassador of the Dairy Queen brand and be professional in every aspect of performance  
   Enthusiastically greet and welcome fans to the Dairy Queen brand  
  Strive to exceed fan expectations and deliver fan first service through timely and quality service 
  Quickly and accurately prepare food products following restaurant, health, and safety standards 
  Properly and safely operate and maintain restaurant equipment including grill, fryer, freezer, and other cooking equipment 
  Complete assigned preparation work for stocking and setting up grill area 
  Calmly solve fan concerns and embrace Dairy Queen’s service recovery standards 
  Be a willing team player and maintain a cooperative, harmonious working relationship with management and fellow team members 
  Create and maintain a positive, safe, clean, and inviting environment for fans and team members 
  At all times exhibit a genuine passion for excellence 
  Perform other duties as assigned by management 
  
  Requirements 
  
  Communicate positively with fans and co-workers constantly during shifts 
  Work well under pressure packed situations while maintaining a great attitude 
  Comfortable standing for entire shift and able to lift 50 pounds 
  Ability to handle raw, frozen, and cooked food products as well as products in and out of the temperature danger zone (41-140F) 
  Practice established food handling procedures and meet any local health regulations 
  Exhibit good manners, proper personal hygiene, and promptness 
  Competent and proficient with cake decorating tools 
  Cake decorator’s certificate and/or previous cake decorating work 
  Have fun and maintain a positive attitude at all times!
 
  
  
  Why it matters: 
  Our team provides a full range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build, fuel, feed and grow Western Canadian communities together. 
  Who you are: 
  You are looking for a career in Customer Service and: 
  
  strong leadership, interpersonal and communication skills 
  positive and professional attitude: Ability to live the Brand 
  provide a high level of personalize member/customer service 
  attentive to detail and able to remain calm under pressure 
  demonstrates reliability; punctuality 
  flexible work schedule 
  
 Our Team Members receive competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package and an employer-contributed pension plan. We encourage our Team Members to take advantage of learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation. 
  At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we’re working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

  • strong leadership, interpersonal and communication skills

  • provide a high level of personalize member/customer service

companyInfo/companyDescription: Eaton is a diversified power management company with more than 100 years of experience providing energy-efficient solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power. With 2011 sales of $16.0 billion, Eaton is a global technology leader in electrical components and systems for power quality, distribution and control; hydraulics components, systems and services for industrial and mobile equipment; aerospace fuel, hydraulics and pneumatic systems for commercial and military use; and truck and automotive drive train and power train systems for performance, fuel economy and safety. For more information, visit www.Eaton.com.
description:
What you’ll do:
   
   
     Eaton Industries (Canada) Company located in Saskatoon, SK, has an opening for a 12-month internship opportunity in our Sales Department.  Our Eaton – Saskatoon, SK sales office is responsible for sales, service, and support of Eaton product including Electrical/Power Distribution, Automation and Control, and Circuit Protection in the Saskatchewan Sales region. The successful candidate will assist the Sales office with any and all inside sales functions including, but not limited to, quotations, technical and product support, data entry and analysis, order entry, and order management.  Primary Responsibilities
     
    
      Assist with inside sales – quotations, data entry and analysis, order entry, and sales support.
      Assist our quotation department with project RFQs including single-line-diagram and specification review.
      Assist our quotation department with assembling quote packages and RFQ file management.
      Supply our outside sales team with inside sales support, such as fielding technical product inquiries, order entry, and order expedites.
      Perform all job functions with adherence to Eaton’s Values and Philosophy, as well as the Safety and Environmental Standards.
    
     Learn who Eaton is, and what Eaton has to offer as a future career option! This work term will apply your theoretical knowledge, expand your understanding of the industry, and give you the opportunity to enhance your understanding of electrical distribution and control
   
  
  
   
     Qualifications:
   
   
      Basic Qualifications
     
    
      Currently enrolled in an accredited Electrical, Mechanical, or Power Systems Engineering or business-related Degree or Diploma Co-op program.
      Legally authorized to work in Canada without company sponsorship.
      This position does not offer relocation.
    
     Preferred Qualifications
     
    
      0 - 5 years of experience in manufacturing electrical power distribution and/or control products.
      Previous sales or customer service experience is considered an asset.
      Must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
      Strong problem-solving skills and time-management capabilities.
      Ability to read and understand blueprints and schematics.
      Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically PowerPoint and Excel.
      Passion for innovation and continuous improvement, and willingness to challenge status quo.
    
     Accessibility Statement  “Eaton has in-place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs. Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html
   
  
 
  We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.
descriptionHTML:
What you’ll do:


Eaton Industries (Canada) Company located in Saskatoon, SK, has an opening for a 12-month internship opportunity in our Sales Department.

Our Eaton – Saskatoon, SK sales office is responsible for sales, service, and support of Eaton product including Electrical/Power Distribution, Automation and Control, and Circuit Protection in the Saskatchewan Sales region. The successful candidate will assist the Sales office with any and all inside sales functions including, but not limited to, quotations, technical and product support, data entry and analysis, order entry, and order management.

Primary Responsibilities


  • Assist with inside sales – quotations, data entry and analysis, order entry, and sales support.
  • Assist our quotation department with project RFQs including single-line-diagram and specification review.
  • Assist our quotation department with assembling quote packages and RFQ file management.
  • Supply our outside sales team with inside sales support, such as fielding technical product inquiries, order entry, and order expedites.
  • Perform all job functions with adherence to Eaton’s Values and Philosophy, as well as the Safety and Environmental Standards.


Learn who Eaton is, and what Eaton has to offer as a future career option! This work term will apply your theoretical knowledge, expand your understanding of the industry, and give you the opportunity to enhance your understanding of electrical distribution and control


Qualifications:


Basic Qualifications


  • Currently enrolled in an accredited Electrical, Mechanical, or Power Systems Engineering or business-related Degree or Diploma Co-op program.
  • Legally authorized to work in Canada without company sponsorship.
  • This position does not offer relocation.


Preferred Qualifications


  • 0 - 5 years of experience in manufacturing electrical power distribution and/or control products.
  • Previous sales or customer service experience is considered an asset.
  • Must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and time-management capabilities.
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints and schematics.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Passion for innovation and continuous improvement, and willingness to challenge status quo.


Accessibility Statement

“Eaton has in-place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs. Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  Discover more about potash at Nutrien! An exciting opportunity awaits a motivated student or new grad at our Lanigan Potash Mine beginning May 2024 for a 16-month term (May 2024 - August 2025). This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position open to current students or new grads. This position is not available for remote work.
 
  What you will do:
  
 
 
   Assist with a variety of mechanical engineering tasks
   Support ongoing and new engineering studies, existing asset inspection/condition reporting, drawing updates, and document control
   Design work and project management are potential opportunities depending on the aptitude of the candidate
 
 
  What you will bring:
 
 
   Minimum 2 years of undergraduate Mechanical, Electrical and/or Computer Engineering program (or equivalent) at an accredited post-secondary institution.
   Experience working in a mining or industrial environment is preferred
   Superior interpersonal, teamwork and communication skills are essential
   Positive safety behavior and safety leadership
   Ability to work safely and effectively in a team environment as well as independently
   Willingness to learn and gain adequate knowledge and experience through training
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

description:
At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 23,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.
 
  Within Nutrien, we have multiple opportunities for voluntarily self-identified students or new grads of Canadian Indigenous ancestry to gain valuable experience in the field of Engineering, Technology, Business and IT at several of our locations.
  
 
 
   Potential locations for Saskatchewan: Allan, Cory, Lanigan, Patience Lake, Vanscoy, Saskatoon and Rocanville
   Start Dates: January 2024 and May 2024
   Lengths of Terms Available: 4, 8, 12 or 16 Months
   Program Target: Intended to introduce a voluntarily self-identified student or new grad of Canadian Indigenous ancestry to opportunities in Engineering, Technology, Business or IT at Nutrien.
 
  What you will bring:
  
 
 
   Currently pursuing post secondary education in the fields of Engineering, Technology, Business, or IT at an accredited post-secondary institution or a new grad within the last 2 years.
 
  What to expect with the recruitment process: Express Interest -> Recruiter Review -> Matched to a Position -> Recruiter Prescreen -> Interview -> Offer -> Background Check -> Hire
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
BHP is a world-leading resources company. Our corporate purpose is to bring people and resources together to build a better world. We do this through our strategy: to have the best capabilities, best commodities and best assets, to create long-term value and high returns. We are among the world’s top producers of major commodities, including iron ore, metallurgical coal and copper. We also have substantial interests in oil, gas and energy coal.

With more than 80,000 employees and contractors, working across 90 locations worldwide, our people sit at the very heart of everything we do. At BHP, we are focused on creating a safe workplace where our people feel connected to our values and objectives and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

True to our purpose, we are committed to providing a safe, inclusive and diverse workplace; this commitment is embedded in Our Charter because we know it’s critical to our success. Local Inclusion and Diversity Council’s operate in our Asset’s and offices around the globe, following the same priorities. Our people are the driving force behind bringing our aspirational goal to achieve gender balance by 2025 to life. By aspiring for gender balance, we will create a safer, more harmonious culture. We want BHP to be a place where everyone is respected and valued and want it to be an enjoyable and inclusive place to work.

We're changing things up by asking everyone what their ‘flex’ looks like so we can create new definitions of flexibility where traditionally there has been none. We’ve found this to be the single biggest driver in helping us to promote greater workforce diversity – and that’s why it continues to be a key focus for BHP.

In addition to having the right assets in the right commodities, we also create value in the way we operate our assets. Our Operating Model allows us to leverage integrated systems and technology, replicate expertise and apply high standards of governance and transparency. 

We love new opinions and innovative ideas. It's the unique experiences and perspectives of our teams that will lead us into the future we're trying to create. We have tremendously talented people at BHP, but our teams are always looking for smarter and more agile ways of doing things to get there faster. Not to mention we have some great leaders here focused on supporting our next great leaders.
description:
Date: 24 Feb 2024 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Posting End Date: 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Country: Canada 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job State/Province: Saskatchewan 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Location/Region: Saskatoon
    
   
  
 
 


 
  About BHP 
 
 
  At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills, and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.
 
  
  
 
  Come and be a part of this success!
   
 
 
  About Potash
  
 
  The Jansen project in Saskatchewan, Canada is set to become one of the largest potash mines in the world and is located approximately 140 kilometers east of Saskatoon.
 
  
 
   BHP’s CAD$14 billion (US$10.5 billion) investment in the Jansen project will deliver a potash mine in Saskatchewan designed to maximize sustainability. As the largest investment in Saskatchewan’s history, Jansen is expected to generate approximately 5,500 workforce opportunities during construction and 900 long-term roles.
 
  
 
   Jansen's construction will take place over several years with first production planned for late 2026. Once fully ramped up, Jansen is expected to have an initial production capacity of approximately 8.5 million tonnes per annum (Mtpa), with the potential to produce 16 to 17 Mtpa in future stages.
 
  
 
 
  Potash at BHP: Enriched by our experiences
 
  
  
 
  Purpose 
 
 
  Our purpose is to bring people and resources together to build a better world. This is why we exist as a company and at the heart of this is our people. At BHP, our people work together to learn and embrace new ways to discover their potential and we always put the health and safety of our people first. The history of BHP has shown that teams that are more inclusive and diverse deliver safety benefits, have a better culture and are more productive than other teams. This is an amazing opportunity for a dynamic individual to be a part of something big to work with an innovative, diverse, global team, with evolving and new technology, and playing a pivotal role in building a world class mine and potential new resource pillar for BHP.
 
  
  
 
  Here at BHP Potash, we provide various student work opportunities within our organization. We are eager to hear from driven Canadian students seeking outstanding opportunities to enhance their student work experiences. We highly encourage students studying Engineering, Computer Science, and Business to apply to these positions. Only those students returning to their program after the completion of their work term will qualify.
 
  
  
 
  About the Roles 
 
 
  Applies an understanding of engineering-, business-, technology-related terminology, key processes, and activities. 
  Employs specific/relevant discipline expertise and leadership to meet BHP's technical expectations, i.e. 
   
    Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Mining/Geological, Electrical, Environmental, etc.) 
    Business (Accounting, Supply Chain, Human Resources, Marketing, Finance, etc.) 
    Technology (Software Development, Cybersecurity, System Programmer, Network Administrator, Infrastructure Architect, etc.) 
    Geosciences (Earth Science, Geology, Geophysics, Environmental Geoscience, etc.) 
   
  Assesses change impacts to prepare integrated change management plans, manages change readiness and resistance, and upskills leaders and impacted stakeholders in the adoption and successful delivery of the change. 
  Determines the underlying cause of problems and evaluates multiple solutions to ensure a planned and structured approach to solving complex problems. 
  Identifies, engages, and manages a range of diverse internal and external stakeholders. 
  Identifies and assesses risks, makes risk informed decisions, uses BHP's risk management framework, and builds a risk aware culture to support safe and productive performance outcomes. Sources information, plans and conducts analyses to support evidence-based decision making. 
 
 
  Work Locations
  
 
  These positions are located at either our Saskatoon office and/or Jansen site. The work schedule for these positions is generally 40 hours per week (Monday – Friday). Hybrid working (flexible, shared workstations and a combination of office and work from home) is standard for BHP.
 
  
  
 
  About You
  
 
  Excellent verbal, written, presentation and interpersonal skills required. 
  Have a growth mindset and learning agility. 
  Understand stakeholder priorities. 
  Collaborate with key decision makers across the organization to support change. 
  Attention to detail and strong commitment to BHP’s values/purpose. 
  Professional verbal and written communications. 
  Strong initiative and ability to work unsupervised. 
  Ability to travel domestically as needed.
 
  
  
 
 
  Supporting a Diverse Workforce
  
 
  At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that is more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognize that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.
 
  
 
   BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.
 
  
 
   At BHP, we aim to unlock the enormous potential that diverse and inclusive teams bring to the workplace, to leave a strong legacy within and beyond our operations for the generations to come.
 
  
 
   Based on existing demographics in our Potash project preference in hiring will be given to qualified women and Indigenous peoples who self-identify as such in the application process. This reasonable and justifiable measure has been implemented pursuant to section 56 of The Saskatchewan Human Rights Code, 2018.
 
  
 
   The BHP Jansen project marks the largest investment in Saskatchewan’s history, and with that growth will come significant employment opportunities. With first production projected to occur late in 2026, from now until the project fully ramps up there will be significant recruitment requirements over the coming months and years. To find out more about the project, hints and tips on our process, and where a career with BHP Potash can take you, sign up to our talent updates here.

description:
Since 1998, Global Gathering Place (GGP) has remained dedicated to helping refugees and immigrants integrate and thrive in Canada. By delivering critical services, English classes, and a full calendar of programs, we work hard in service of our vision: A society where newcomers to Canada are fully engaged and valued. 
        Our LINC and Stage 1 & 2 Instructors ensure the planning and successful delivery of language instruction and assessment to clients registered with our language programs. The ideal candidate has a post-secondary education, minimum CERTESL certificate or equivalent, teaching experience, and is available to teach on evenings & Saturdays. 
        Responsibilities: 
        
         Teaches assigned classes at assigned times and online via Zoom or in a blended model 
        
        
         Coordinates the online and/or in person classroom to be organized and engaging, and displays material that is reflective of student learning. 
        
        
         Supports student learning by providing appropriate instruction based on program guidelines and evaluations, particularly with regard to the Canadian Language Benchmarks (CLB) and Portfolio-Based Language Assessment (PBLA). 
        
        
         Meets learning objectives through design and implementation of unit plans, curricula, and real-life learning based on students’ needs and goals, approved modules/themes, and benchmark levels. 
        
        
         Maintains regular student records, attendance, and progress on the database. 
        
        
         Prepares monthly/quarterly reports, progress reports, and other program-related documents when needed. 
        
        
         Collaborates with administrative staff to coordinate placements, transfers, graduations and exits, and resolve student concerns. 
        
        
         In collaboration with the ESL Team Lead, makes substitute arrangements for missed classes. 
        
        
         Facilitates appropriate referrals and access to services to respond to student needs. 
        
        
         Performs all other duties as assigned.

  • Teaches assigned classes at assigned times and online via Zoom or in a blended model
  • Coordinates the online and/or in person classroom to be organized and engaging, and displays material that is reflective of student learning.
  • Supports student learning by providing appropriate instruction based on program guidelines and evaluations, particularly with regard to the Canadian Language Benchmarks (CLB) and Portfolio-Based Language Assessment (PBLA).
  • Meets learning objectives through design and implementation of unit plans, curricula, and real-life learning based on students’ needs and goals, approved modules/themes, and benchmark levels.
  • Maintains regular student records, attendance, and progress on the database.
  • Prepares monthly/quarterly reports, progress reports, and other program-related documents when needed.
  • Collaborates with administrative staff to coordinate placements, transfers, graduations and exits, and resolve student concerns.
  • In collaboration with the ESL Team Lead, makes substitute arrangements for missed classes.
  • Facilitates appropriate referrals and access to services to respond to student needs.
  • Performs all other duties as assigned.

companyInfo/companyDescription:
If you're interested in a career path with a global leader in sustainable agriculture, then Nutrien just might be the right fit for you.

At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 24,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.

We invest in our people through education, training, mentoring, and career development planning. We offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a collaborative and purpose-driven work environment.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
description:
At Nutrien, our purpose is Feeding the Future and we do so with safety, inclusion, integrity and results as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 
  Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With nearly 25,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers globally.
 
  We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, act with integrity, and who support inclusion.
 
  Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us raise the expectation of what an agriculture company can be and grow your career.
 
  Discover more about potash at Nutrien! An exciting co-op opportunity awaits a motivated student at our Cory beginning may 2024 for a 16-month term. This is a temporary, full-time, hourly-paid position open to current students who will be returning to their studies once this work term is complete. This position is not available for remote work.
 
  What you will do:
  
 
 
   Provide CAD/3D modeling support for the mine maintenance engineering department
   Develop and implement solutions to existing challenges associated with the mining process
   Apply Nutrien's core values and principles of engagement during daily tasks
   Collaborate with superintendents, supervisors, trades and operations personnel
   Provide project management assistance for capital projects specific to the mine and shaft areas
   Collect and analyze data from real time monitoring of pumps, conveyor belts and mining machines
   Participate in the assessment of our underground assets and recommend corrective actions
   Work with external service providers, create and send out procurement packages and evaluate quotes/proposals.
 
 
  What you will bring:
 
 
   Must be currently enrolled and completed at least 2 years of an undergraduate Mechanical Engineering program (or equivalent) at an accredited post-secondary institution AND returning to full-time studies after the work term.
   Alignment with Nutrien’s purpose and values
 
 
  Are you a good match? Apply today!
 
  The estimated salary that Indeed, Glassdoor and LinkedIn suggested does not represent Nutrien's compensation structure.
 
  Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 
  This job will remain posted until filled. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

companyInfo/companyDescription: Unverferth is a leading family owned manufacturer and marketer of tillage equipment, pull-type sprayers, fertilizer applicators, hay and grain handling equipment, and agricultural dual and specialty wheels. The family owned atmosphere which promotes pride in employee growth and longevity that is as prevalent today as it was over 70 years ago.
description:
Job Duties and Accountabilities 
  
 Principal Function of the Position: 
  Responsible for providing product and program support for inside sales personnel, Territory Managers, branch operations, external customers, dealer networks and other related sales entities. This individual will also be required to provide technical documentation, analysis and assistance for internal support functions such as marketing, advertising, design engineering, quality assurance, tooling & prototype and manufacturing. This position requires traveling up to 50% of the term performing product demonstrations and training programs for outside sales, branch operations and dealer networks, and assists in the preparation, setup, manning and dismantling of various Unverferth product offerings throughout the United States. 
  Primary Product Support & Training Responsibilities: 
  
  
   Assist with product improvement programs and product information to external customers.
   
  
   Assist with product improvement programs and product information to inside sales personnel.
   
  
   Assist with product improvement programs and product information to outside sales personnel.
   
  
   Provide telephone support for product service & technical issues facing territory managers.
   
  
   Provide technical support for product questions generated by customers, dealers and outside sales.
   
  
   Provide recommendations for product enhancements to various product lines.
   
  
   Provide Trade Show support for all Unverferth (Brent) product lines.
   
  
   Perform external product service calls with territory managers as required.
   
  
   Review and update knowledge of existing and new product offerings for that area.
  
 
  
  
  
  Educational Requirements 
  
 Prefer a minimum of two years working toward a Bachelor’s degree in Agri-Business, Ag-Systems Technology, Agriculture Engineering or other related discipline or field of study. Prior familiarity and/or hands-on experience with agricultural equipment and farming operations would be beneficial.
  
  
  
  Prerequisite Skills and Work Experience 
 
 
  Prior experience and/or familiarity in internal / external product support function. 
  Prior experience and/or familiarity in dealing with external customers, dealers and/or vendors. 
  Prior experience and/or familiarity with performing face-to-face training programs / presentations. 
  Possess proficient written, verbal and telephone communications skills. 
  Possess proficient computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Word, Excel & Power Point.
 
  
  
  About Us: 
  
  Family owned, world class farm equipment manufacturing since 1948 
  Wide variety of agricultural implements 
  State of the art manufacturing facilities and equipment 
  Focus on quality manufacturing while maintaining a safe and healthy workplace

description:
Lake Lenore Co-op is hiring 4 Summer Students in our Agro Division. 
  Duties & Responsibilities 
  
  Come to work with a positive, professional approach and attitude 
  Be dependable for all scheduled shifts 
  Understand and align with Lake Lenore Co-op’s brand standards and values of integrity, dependability, and customer service 
  Warehouse maintenance and inventory quality control 
  Loading and delivering chemical orders for farm customers; loading fertilizer to trucks 
  Operate forklift and skid steer 
  Build relationships with farm customers and staff 
  Support the Agro team with in-season crop scouting 
  Assist with any tasks around the yard and maintain field plot trials 
  Adhere to Lake Lenore Co-ops Health and Safety Program and all Lake Lenore Co-ops policies and procedures 
  
 Qualifications 
  
  Post-secondary schooling in Agriculture is preferred, with agronomic competence as an asset 
  Must be able to achieve warehousing license i.e. WHIMS and TDG 
  Ability to work outdoors for extended periods of time 
  Ability to do some manual labor and ability to lift 50lbs unassisted 
  Dependable, motivated and safety conscious 
  Valid class 5 drivers’ license 
  
 Reports to: Agro Manager and Agronomists 
  Apply by: February 28, 2023
